description:
I love this spot, so much so I actually eat here every other week. When my partner and I first came to San Francisco, Thai Thai became our go-to neighborhood spot thanks to its convenient hours and friendly wait staff. The food too, in our experience, has always been delicious. While we've ordered all around the menu, we've happily settled  on the SF Seafood Green Curry Fried Rice and the Pad Kee Mao as our go-to orders. 

I'm writing this in a hotel room across the country on the east coast, missing home and missing this  neighborhood spot that knows my order by heart.
author: R C.

description:
Nice Thai restaurant that is open late. The service is friendly and courteous. Clean restaurant with a nice atmosphere. Prices are reasonable. The Thai food is average.

The Pad Thai with cellophane noodles was fresh but lacked the nice Thai flavor of the regular Pad Thai. It was fresh tasting but rather bland.

The Tom Yum soup was good but not great.

Best thing about this place is that it is open late for San Francisco.
author: Joe L.

description: Amazing service and super sweet family own. The food was perfect and experience was out of this world. Kwang was amazing and the staff took care of be.
author: Adonai T.

description: I am not really sure why this place survives other than the endless delivery orders that come in. There are rarely any actual dining guests. The food is tasteless, slim to no seasoning and they cook everything in the same location. Yes a main ingredient of the style of food is fish sauce, practically everything tastes fishy. The location is rather nice but the service really lacks. I have tried several dishes, however they all lack flavor and taste. Well other than the fishy taste. Glad their are 5 other Food Styles right in the same general area!
author: Dustin S.

description: This place has great Thai food. I enjoyed the garlic green curry with shrimp dish it was so yummy. The portions of the yellow chicken curry was plenty and delicious. The inside of the restaurant  was roomy and fun. The coconut milk ship with mushroom soup was so tasty. This place is so good that they named it twice, Thai Thai.
author: Juan V.

description: Great service and delicious food. Panang beef curry was flavorful and plentiful. Loved the braised beef in it. Thee beef was very well cooked and seasoned. I didn't like that the small rice was an extra $2. I sorta think curry should come with a rice...
author: Vicky T.

description:
Oh Thai Thai, you got some winners and some losers. 

Now I only came in for some quick take out while running some errands in Nob Hill so I didn't get the whole experience. With that being said, the food is what I am reviewing. I got the chicken skewers and the chicken pad thai. 

The skewers were the tastiest skewers I have had in a long time. The chicken was cooked perfectly, nice and juicy, and the flavor was packed into the seasoning. The peanut sauce was the real winner of the dish. Great consistency and peanut flavor that wasn't too over whelming, jusssst right. 

Now on to the pad thai, let's talk about the good. The chicken was cooked right and so were the noodles. What hurt me was the flavor of the pad thai, or lack there was. I wanted more spices and even a bit of heat!   

The food was quick like lighting to come out after I ordered it, yay! They packaged the food really well so it was still warm once I got home. Double yay! Now I know to explore the menu more the next time I get take out!
author: Nicole K.

description:
Did I mention my love of Khao Soi to you before? It combines my favorite elements into one beautiful bowl: chewy noodles, crunchy noodles, tender chicken, soup, curry flavor, and memories of Chiang Mai.

I'm always drawn to khao soi when I see it on the menu and my friend who took me here recommended it so of course I had to try it out. My assessment? Not bad but not that great either.

The portion size and ratios of each of the components seemed right. The crunchy noodles were good. But the chewy noodles below were not cooked well and clumped up. If it wasn't for the solid flavor overall, it would've gotten 3 stars. Also, the "soup" portion was a bit thick.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Not too bad considering it's open late and walking distance from me. I'd be back for the convenience factor, but the food here seems to be a hit or miss. 

The Pad Kee Mao was realllllly good (5/5), but the tofu yellow curry was terrible (0/5). No flavor whatsoever and the veggies had a weird frozen aftertaste. When you have leftovers and don't even want them, that's no bueno. 

Buuuut the pad kee mao is reallllly good so I'd come back for that.
author: Laverne N.

description: Thai Thai noodle has been a go to since I've moved back to NorCal. The food is always fresh, cooked fast and the service is usually good! The calamari and veggie spring rolls, fried or rolled fresh, are amazing!
author: Deondre J.

description: Slightly bland, average Thai food. I ordered take out from here. Pad see ew was pretty bland and thought it had more chicken than noodles. Green curry was better. If I came here again I would try to ask for more spice.
author: Daniela J.

description: Couples things about this place - service is extremely slow and every time I've been here it takes about 20 minutes to flag down a waiter just to get the check which always leaves the whole table feeling a little impatient to get out of there. The food is okay; my favorite dishes are definitely the noodle soups which I absolutely prefer! I always get the Tom Yum soup with rice noodle and I've loved it every time.
author: Alysia T.

description: I order here at least once a week. All of the Pads are dope, and so are the curries. Thai Thai for the win!
author: Andrew K.

description: I feel like Thai Thai is a solid 4-4.5 stars. My favorite dish is the pumpkin curry with coconut rice. It's creamy, full of flavor, and both sweet and savory at the same time. I've also tried the soup while sick which seemed to help clear things up. The restaurant is small/medium but in a central location and the service is prompt and friendly. I've also never had to wait for a table. Plus, they have delivery! There might be better, swankier, Thai food in SF, sure, but this is one of the best in the Nob Hill/Polk Gulch area!
author: Stefanie K.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant in town, however extremely inconsistent. We order the same dishes over and over again, but still have to worry about a dish being (much) more spicy than the time before, or the cashew chicken not having.... cashews. 

When they're on, they're on, but sadly scarily inconsistent.
author: Kaili L.

description:
I only live a couple blocks away from Thai Thai and I have only a handful of times. 

4/5: Drunken Noodles. I only ever get the drunken noodles as my main meal because it is safe. I personally can't handle any spicy food whatsoever, and Thai food is just that. The first time (maybe second time) I ever went here, I asked for no spicy to the noodles at all. The waiter agreed and wrote it down. When it arrived to me, it was unbearably spicy (to me at least.) I didn't have time to have them remake it so I ate it. The meal itself when it is not spicy is very OK. There could be a bit more food variety to it, but it is very good nonetheless.  

The service is pretty decent. Very quick at getting you sat down, drinks served, food ordered and served. But for some reason, feel like they are a bit unorganized. Can't quite figure out how/why though.

Allin all, this place is good! Not a place I would visit all the time, but a nice place to enjoy every few months or so.
author: Michael T.

description: The food here is good but rice isn't included with the curry so a simple curry/rice can cost you close to $20. That aside the food is tasty, the shrimp and pumpkin curry had a great flavor and the portions were big enough I had leftovers for lunch the next day. They are quick and friendly.
author: Sarah F.

description: Kind of bland on everything we ordered (pad thai and curry). You don't get spice level options either. It being open late is probably on of the best things about it.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Favorite Thai place! Great bbq beef and chicken dishes and the coconut rice is yum!!

Also the staff is really nice!

If you are looking for a new regular Thai place definitely go here you will not be disappointed!
author: Sandra C.

description:
I have always really liked this place and praise it as an underestimated restaurant. Good quality and decent prices. However the most recent time I went here I ordered panang curry and pad Thai for take out both with chicken. The pad Thai was literally filled with tofu and one piece of chicken and the Penang curry was also a mix of chicken and tofu. When we called because we thought there was a mistake they said they are supposed have a mix if chicken and tofu. I have never had their chicken pad Thai with tofu. A bit odd???? Never had it this way after eating here many times. 
We called and they did exchange our pad Thai in 10 minutes with the pad Thai I was initially expecting. Delicious and filled with chicken.  Great service and hoping they continue this way. Would recommend.
author: Sormeh K.

description: They ran out of pad see ew on a Friday night (really ridiculous, I know), so I had to get the tom yum soup instead. The soup was too sweet and creamy for my liking and definitely not like traditional tom yum. I probably won't go back unless I happened to find myself in the area again, since there aren't very many food options there.
author: Jules C.

description: Tom yum noodle soup cost $17. Ridiculous that the server does not tell me over the phone that seafood is a $5 add on if you don't get chicken or beef. The soup is not even full. Total rip off and would never come here again.
author: Janice Y.

description: Thai Thai Noodle is amazing. There's not one item on their menu I've tried that didn't exceed my expectation both in taste and in portion, and I've had their pan fried noodles, fried rice, soups and desserts. But the real surprise is their fish dishes. This place has absolutely the best salmon & catfish out of all the Thai restaurants in the area, and they give you as least twice as much protein for the same price as anyone else. If you love fish, you cannot go wrong with this place.
author: Carl W.

description: Got the beef pad Thai delivered. It was not very good. Very bland. Ordered and paid for extra beef and still was very skimpy with the meat. Not getting again.
author: Matt R.

description: Perfect neighborhood spot to satiate your Thai cravings. Wide variety of options and excellently executed dishes of curries, rice, noodles, and meat entrees. Deliveries are fast and convenient. And most importantly, wonderful service who appreciate return customers. Can not recommend this place enough,
author: Marc P.

description: Simple straightforward noodle dishes, fast, good stuff. I've only tried their basic noodle soup, which I need and like, and it checked the mark. Simple, not-oily, lots of ingredients and noodles el-dente. A good quick lunch stop
author: Juls C.

description:
Utterly inconsistent. I have ordered takeout from this place over 10 times in the last 3 years and I always get the same thing: pad see ew. Sometimes it comes with regular broccoli. Sometimes it comes with Chinese broccoli. Sometimes it comes with carrots. It's never the same. Sometimes it's some combination of the three. Sometimes the sauce is super vinegary. Sometimes it comes liberally seasoned with massive dashes of white pepper on top. Sometimes the portion size is massive and other times it barely fills the container. 

The point is, I never know what I'm going to get. But Thai Thai is pretty cheap and fast. And it's never inedible. It just frustrates me that I don't know what my food will taste like until I take the first bite.
author: Leslie H.

description: Not good at all. Service is not good, can't seem to get them to wait on you. Waited about 15 minutes before she took the order. And she took our order it was another 25 before the food came out to us. And mostly it was bland, lack of souse and flavor made me wish I had just gone to a different place. FOR SURE WILL NEVER GO AGAIN!
author: Amos M.

description: I had an amazing experience the first time I came here, and perhaps that is because they weren't busy.  The next time I came they were completely packed, which is great for them, but I felt bad for this single waitress.  It took about 10 minutes just to get asked for our drink order.  Once we ordered, my pad thai was undercooked with the peanut sauce being extremely watery.  Then we had to remind them that we ordered an appetizer which finally came when we were about half way done with our main course.  I am still a fan, and will be coming back, but if they are busy I would plan for slower service.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
Ordered Pad Thai, Papaya Salad, veggie egg rolls, and tom kha. 

The veggie rolls and Tom Kha were totally delicious.  Unfortunately the pad Thai and papaya salad were terrible. Pad Thai was cold, tasteless, and dry. The papaya salad had more cabbage than papaya. 

If you can't get Pad Thai right, something is definitely wrong.

I called in and the individual was very nice however not very helpful. She thanked me for the call and letting them know.  Don't know if I would order here again.
author: Anthony K.

description: Unbelievably good D9 on their menu!  Seafood Soft Curry. Shrimp, calamari, catfish in an egg yellow curry with celery, carrot, green onions, red & green peppers.  A 5 Star dish to die for! $14.95!  California & Hyde, SF.  Delicious!
author: Joshua C.

description: Ordered the Thai spicy beef and coconut rice. Very good combo, and the beef was cooked such that it was like biting into a juicy steak. Easily one of the better Thai restaurants in the area.  Would have preferred coconut rice to not have the cream, but it was very rich and pleasant with the food. Will order again.
author: Charles L.

description: Local place when nothing else is open for Thai. They don't really seem to get it right, that's all I can say.
author: Sharon M.

description:
This place is way under-rated. The food is great and comes out really fast.

Can't go wrong with their Pad See Ew and Seafood Green Curry Fried Rice.
author: Leo S.

description: A good neighborhood Thai restaurant with lots of veggie/vegan options. They have a whole vegetarian lovers section, and many more dishes can be made vegetarian/vegan by request from the rest of their extensive menu. Got the spicy eggplant tofu with yellow onion, bell pepper, basil leaves, and fermented soybean--done really well. The eggplant was cooked perfectly and the tofu had that crunchy exterior that I like. The $10-12 price range for main dishes is standard for this area, but portion sizes are bigger. I've gone here several times throughout the years and they've improved. I'm become more and more of a fan and will definitely continue to go back.
author: Jay C.

description: I live next door to this place. I love them and their kind and friendly staff!!! I will go here forever for the delicious tofu Tom khan soup. Hits the spot every time!
author: Shannon E.

description: This is my favorite Thai place in the city!  Not only is the food good, the service great, but they are kind.  Last week I ordered there as I often do.  It was a rainy night, they were busy (which they said), but there was a significant delay.  Additionally, the food took an extra 40 minutes to reach me and the order was wrong.  I was pretty annoyed and called expecting a slight discount.  However, due to my longtime patronage, the extremely long wait, and the mix up- the meal was free.  They were incredibly understanding and willing to make amends for their error.  I'm a definite fan of the food and the level of service.
author: Jay N.

description:
I order from this place a lot. And lately their food and service has become less and less enjoyable. At first I thought it was due to using waiter.com, but I have had my food rushed to me before the actual suggested time and I have had the same food delivered that it was actually very good! 
Today however, I was very disappointed!! Food arrived 45min after the suggested time. When I asked the driver what took so long, he told me traffic... what traffic? It's only a 15min drive and their is no traffic from there to here, especially on a Sunday!! 
Second, no one should have to eat their order cold. Not one item I ordered was warm. Thank god I have a microwave other I would have been stuck with crap I couldn't enjoy!! I usually order the crab fried rice, pad see ew, Basil chicken and BBQ chicken over salad. BBQ chicken got me started while I was heating the other food. The marination wasn't so bad so I was grateful for that. But that's the only good thing I could say. The crab fried rice was ok, the basil chicken wasn't too shabby and the pad see ew was just bleh!! It tasted sweet and I could barely take another bite and having that god awful taste in my mouth go away.. 
like most people said, this place is a hit or miss. It doesn't matter if you are the first order or last order, you don't know what you are going to get until you taste. One star gone for the late delivery, one star gone for lying about why you are late and one star for the cold tasteless sweet food I received instead of a hot meal!!  
Btw, if you do use services such waiter.com, doordash etc.. if you have to call them for the order status to be checked, then most likely you are going to get your food kind of cold and your time wasted for being dumb enough to wait as long as I did.. I would rather eat a frozen dinner than what I had to experience today..
author: George A.

description: The tom yum soup was really good. Probably the most flavorful tom yum I've had in a while. For all you mushroom lovers, they were generous with the mushroom, and also the meat! On top of it all, service was great!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
My go-to Thai takeout in the neighborhood.  Thai Thai Noodle offers dine in, pick up, or delivery. I recommend the pick up option as the delivery can sometimes take up to 45 minutes (even though I live about two blocks away).  The service is SO SO QUICK. I order, walk up the street and bam, already done. Fresh ingredients, friendly service, consistently good options and very affordable for the area. 
yummmm.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
A spot for ubiquitous Thai food on Nob Hill. Nothing really stands out but the food is decent and the service is friendly. 

A friend of mine frequents Thai Thai given the proximity to home so off we went for dinner one Sunday. We were the only ones in the restaurant since it was later in the evening and thus service was attentive and our orders were delivered in a jiffy. I had the Panang Curry Stewed Beef with some jasmine rice. It had good flavor but also nothing really different from other Panang curries. It wasn't too spicy so ask them to dial up the heat if that's what you're looking for - I thought it was fine. The beef was soft and tender which was nice. 

Thai Thai will do in the pinch if you are lazy and don't want to travel but I know there are better places within a ten minute walk.
author: Jon L.

description: I ordered the Tom kha noodle soup with beef. It was easily the worst soup I have ever had from a Thai restaurant. Devoid of flavor and ingredients. I would never order anything from here again. It was really bad...
author: Justin H.

description:
I wrote a review of this place when they first opened. I think I was the 2nd to review. That was about 8 years ago. Strangely that review is now gone, so, on to the new...
I have come to Thai Thai on and off over the years. My default order has been Pad See Ew or Pad Thai which has consistently been good. Lately I've had the stewed chicken which was really amazing.
Stopped in tonight for the first time in a while. Seems the menu has changed somewhat but staff is mostly the same. Tried something I haven't had yet off the "Dinner" options, a chicken noodle curry dish to go.
BAM. Opened this up at home and as usual was too hot to handle. Had to carefully pour the curry into a bowl so as not to burn myself. This, mind you, on the night of the highest temperature ever recorded in SF; an amazing and altogether not entirely pleasant 98 degrees or so at time of ordering, around 6:30 p.m.
This meal hit the nail on the head again, just as other meals have from here. Curry was beautiful; creamy, spicy and really nothing at all wrong with it. Noodles were cooked well and chicken was pleasant. 
I don't see how anyone can complain about this place. I've been to the Thai greats (Ben Thai, Ler Ros, etc.). Those places are great but you have to keep in mind the power of hype. Sometimes all you need is a really decent bowl of noodles or Thai dish. This place delivers and if you aren't seeking the best Thai food in the City I think you might be pleasantly surprised.
Glad Thai Thai is still around the corner from me and I look forward to returning soon.
author: Matt H.

description: Coconut ice cream and fried bananas! Bomb ! 2 blocks from The Masonic center . Outstanding food and fast
author: Isaac S.

description: I love this place. Everything I've gotten so far, imperial rolls, pad Thai, fried chicken fried rice and devil wings, were all super yummy. I would buy each one again. Delish!
author: Nancy M.

description: Tom Kha Noodle Soup has delectable flavor. This soup was so satisfying that we decided not to order anything else. Scrumptious and filling. Yum!!
author: Laura K.

description: Love this place. Been coming here for years. Stays open super late, really consistently good food and great service. The cashew chicken is amazing, get it every time. The Penang curry is super delicious too. Great value and very tasty dishes.
author: James D.

description: This place has really bad and unauthentic food. We got the Chicken Satay and Tom Kha soup with tofu. Chicken Satay was really small and didn't come with any vegetables. The soup tasted like flavored water and all the vegetables and tofu were quite tasteless as well. I wouldn't recommend this place. We also got it through UberEats, and it was a ripoff for what we got.
author: Luba Y.

description:
This place is under-rated, it is delicious & almost never packed with people. It's one of my go-to spots when I want some delicious Thai food without long lines of people. It's also open late and does delivery, which is super helpful when you have a case of the drunchies.

Our favorites include the garlic catfish, BBQ chicken, pad see ew, and the spicy green been w/ tofu. Can't go wrong with the curries too.
author: Kelly T.

description:
This is probably the my favorite place in Nob Hill to get takeout on a regular basis. They turned me into a regular. I like their garlic fish, pad see ew, and all their curries are mouthwatering.

It's a nice dine-in place too. Their constantly renovated, so you'll be comfortable. The table's are spacious and has recently updated fixtures, so it's nice to dine-in too.

I'm not the only one with Thai Thai food on my mind. My mom is extremely picky about her Thai food, and she loved this place too. I also brought a few friends here, and they also have a high opinion of Thai Thai Noodle. :)
author: Lainey D.

description: Made an order for pick up. I walked 5 blocks to pick up the order. Once I get home they call me and, surprise, they had given me the wrong order. I walk 5 more blocks back to pick up the correct order and they wouldn't give me a discount or a refund. 20 blocks of walking and I'm still disappointed. I will not be going back again.
author: Brad T.

description: Kinda feeling swooped since I ordered a dish from Eat24 that was advertised as a Rice Dish yet did not come with rice... I called back to let them know and was told it didn't come w rice despite the description. You think when I picked up the food this would have been mentioned the discrepancy but no... I'm local so hopefully this issue can be rectified but if not I will not return... over a portion of rice.
author: Lauren B.

description: The spring rolls gave me food posing... Eneded up in the Emergency room with a viral infection .
author: vicor v.

description:
I eat here every visit for at least lunch. Consistent and easy to locate across from Trader Joe's and off a cable car line too.  There are many horrific places in SFO for Asian food so I'm picky about where I spend my time.  

This is a nice casual place where you can dine solo and not feel strange.  Efficient service and yummy dishes.  

Spice alert:  I'm cool with spice BUT this place automatically makes your food pretty spicy so ask for mild if your threshold is more like Frank's Red Hot and not so much more than that.   

Prices are fine.  Restroom is ok and for customers.  Climate is reasonable every time I visit so it's rare you will suffer on a hot day in other restaurants in SFO where they simply don't have ac.
author: Joe B.

description: The best cashew nut chicken in SF! Portion sizes are generous and staff are very friend! Service is fast. This place is underrated and a little gem! Love it
author: Anne-Marie R.

description:
I've been really happy with this place each time that I've stopped here.

I've had take-out all times except one.  It's a lovely restaurant (see pictures), and I'm surprised that it's not usually more crowded.  There is a nice little counter in the back, and I usually have a bottle of Thai beer while I wait.  

The Thai Thai Pad Thai and the Thai Thai Spicy Beef were both good, and I've had each twice.  I've also had the Pad See Ew and Pad Kee Mao.

For appetizers, I've tried the Por Sod Shrimp (fried shrimp rolls) - I'd need to have them again.  I think that a long time ago I had the Por Jay (vegetarian egg rolls).

Overall, I think it's a good place.  It's also very conveniently located near home - but, I would definitely check it out and dine in their beautiful spot if you're looking for an excuse to come to this neighborhood.  I'm going to try some more things.
author: Adam S.

description:
This restaurant is in nob hill, which makes it convenient. I've gone here probably 5 times out of desperation for Thai food. 

1 - I've ask for "no tofu" every time, and tofu is always on my plate

2 - they serve "American style" Thai ... as in,
Stir fried noodles with some tofu,
Chicken (or whatever you order), and peanuts l... not goo

If you go here, try being clear in what you want (they won't comply though because every dish is made the pre-order). If they actually comply, kudos to them
author: Ben G.

description: A very nice dining experience, from the delicious pineapple fried rice to the egg plant to the friendly staff from the moment we walked in. We will definitely be back.
author: Tommy L.

description: Very fast, friendly staff and relatively cheap. I always go there for vegan meals and they make them really well. Also the portions are decent. Try the Pad Kee Maw with veggies (minus the eggs).
author: Shady E.

description: Came in for a Tom Yum because I was feeling under the weather and wanted some light spicy goodness to warm me up. The soup was a disappointment. The best way I can describe it is "oily lemonade". It was too sweet, too greasy, and had sad rubbery chicken floating in it.
author: Olga L.

description:
This place is decent, they have pretty good thai food under $10. Since I work so close to them, I go here often for lunch. 

I would highly reccomend their Pad Se Eew for anyone coming here for their first time.

That being said, one of their staff could work on their customer service, but everyone else here is very friendly.
author: Chris P.

description:
I've been here a few times, and feel that they've really made some improvements over the past few years. The food used to be bad, and now it's tasty. Service is always friendly, and it's clean, spacious, and pleasant.

Today I was quite happy to find that they serve lunch specials well into late afternoon. You have 3 items (appetizer, soup/salad, and entree) on one plate for $12.95. It was quite satisfying. I had a fried veggie spring roll, tom yum soup, and pad see-ew. Everything was tasty, and the staff were really sweet. It's a very lovely spot to go to lunch in the neighborhood.
author: Wendy K.

description:
After a late night of partying, Thai Thai is a godsend. 

The chicken pad thai is good. The samosas are good. This place is solid all around. 

However, the quality of food mixed with quick delivery times make this a winning combo. Divide estimated delivery time by 2. 

Pro tip: order via grub hub while going home in your uber
author: Robert F.

description:
I have been a regular customer of this place ever since they OPENED. This place has gone down hill after the past 2 years.. It has changed hands and now the food is inconsistent. 

The delivery is HORRIBLE, they can barely take an order on the phone and the last time they screwed up my order which was for DELIVERY.. I called 1.5 hours later asking where my order was and they said they screwed up and thought it was for Pickup.. 

I HAVE NEVER order pickup... I asked them to make sure it was not cold and please recook it..since they screwed up..then deliver it to me.

The delivery person, who also could barely speak English, gave me my order which was COLD. They never reheated it and did not cook another order.

Because it was COLD and OVER 2 hours later, I paid them just for the food and did not tip the driver. -- They did not care to help fix the situation.

VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

This place sucks.. do not order from them.
author: Ronak P.

description: Very good thai food. Just live nearby and it is so convenient. Very fast, the food is amazing, the staff is so polite! I love coming here for lunch or dinner.
author: Veronika J.

description: Slightly pricier than your to-go Thai but for a good reason! The portions are massive. I had my Pad Thai as lunch and dinner ($10). Service was super quick as well!
author: June L.

description: SUPER YUM! We ordered delivery through Yelp and got dinner delivered to our hotel room, which was right down the block (The Scarlet Huntington). Right after I placed the order (like immediately) I got a call from a woman at the restaurant saying they were out of something I ordered and if I wanted to replace it with something else. That means they were on top of their game about receiving orders which was wonderful! (The last experience I had using this service was terrible, so it was much appreicated). The food was still hot when it arrived and the whole process took about 30 minutes even though it said estimated 45-60 minutes. We had the Chicken pad thai, Glass noodle shrimp pad thai and two orders of Imperial Rolls. Everything was delicious! Nothing was too spicy. The prices were totally fair. Definitely recommend for take out! Thanks Thai Thai Noodle!
author: Elyse P.

description:
First time at this place and its meh. Food and service wasn't that great. Probably won't be coming back. 

Good: found a street parking space with ease. But that was all luck. 

What's ok: Crab fried rice was ok. 

Cons: Pad Thai was a bit too sour. Service wasn't great. No thank you's and checking in on us.
author: Kat V.

description: Great food friendly fast service and lots of food. They even allowed me to plug in and charge my iPhone 6s
author: Troy D.

description: The Hi Ma Kai chicken is off the charts. The spicy beef is very good as well. Staff is always super friendly and has gotten my sometimes complex orders right every time. Love this place.
author: Seth S.

description: LOVE this restaurant! Whether I'm eating in or picking up, the food is delicious, well priced, and the staff is welcoming and friendly. They have a lot of vegetarian options and the pick up is quick and easy. This place is awesome :)
author: Mia A.

description:
Pretty standard Thai joint.

I ordered pad basil and asked the waiter if it was spicy, and he said yes. Then, when he handed it to me he said "pad basil spicy". It wasn't very spicy. Barely had any heat at all. It was good, I liked it, but if you like spicy food, ask for your dish extra spicy.
author: Steve N.

description: Friendly staff, large portion, not the most flavorful Pad Thai that I've ever had, but still delicious!
author: Jamie F.

description: It's 2016. Get it together. So tired of businesses that have credit restrictions. If you're open to the public, accept any firm of payment or don't be open at all. $10 minimum for card purchases?? Sorry, don't think so. Wanted to get an iced tea, but guess you weren't interested in business.
author: Marissa W.

description: Have been meaning to try this place out for months as we live close by. Ordered pick up last night and was very happy with all that we ordered (Tom yum soup, pad see ew and green curry). The prices are fair and everything was delicious- it was ready fast too. Definitely will be eating here again.
author: Molly C.

description: Friendly staff. Prompt and courteous. Food was quite good.  My husband had the BBQ chicken fried rice and was very happy. I had the Pad Se ew. It had good flavor.
author: Priscilla B.

description: Pretty good Thai delivery option.  Their tom yum soup was not super salty like most Thai places, and their pad kee mao and crab fried rice were really on point.  Nothing amazing, but everything was pretty good!
author: Lucks N.

description:
This place was very good! We came here to grab a quick bite and were very pleasantly surprised.   We shared a noodle plate that was grubbin and under 10 bucks.
Thai tea not too sweet.
Service excellent.
I'll definitely come back when I'm in the area.
author: Andres M.

description:
Got food thru Waiter.com.
Fresh and tasty is not what you'll get here. 
Food tastes old and tasteless!!!
Fried calamari seemed to have been out of the freezer, with thick crusts.
The seafood soup was tasteless and tasteless morsels.
No more to be said.!
author: Hoyle L.

description:
The great thing about Thai Thai is that it is open late, which is perfect for this section of the city, near Nob Hill, where your choices are often food for the Elite on the Hill, or drinking bars in Polk Gulch, or some non-chain Pizza joint.  

I came late one evening, and it was pretty full with diners still. The staff is Thai, and the food is pretty much what you might usually find in most Thai places. But the food is tasty and reasonably priced. 

You'll find locals eating here, like families, singles getting a good bite, couples. They do a healthy To-Go business, so you know that those are mostly neighborhood regulars. 

IF you are on California Street between Polk and Nob Hill, and can't afford Crustaceans and what something tasty, quick and affordable, try try Thai Thai.
author: Wanugee N.

description: Thai Thai is a really solid restaurant. It's open late and the staff are very efficient and friendly. I've been several times and so far I've had the samosas, fresh and fried spring rolls, pad kee mao (drunken noodles) with tofu, green curry with tofu, and tom kha soup--everything has been very good. Their ginger tea is also excellent. In my mind, Marnee Thai still wins as the best Thai restaurant in the city, but if you're near California and Hyde and looking for late-ish night food and/or Thai, definitely check-out Thai Thai.
author: A E.

description: Dear god! If you order "spicy" get ready for fire burning death!! I'll stick to NO spice next time. I don't even know what the food tasted like because it was so damn spicy. And I love a good heat :(
author: Brittanie H.

description: Pretty decent!  We got our standard dish we order to compare Thai places, pad see ew with chicken.  It was a nice plate full of noodles, greens, eggs and chicken, and the flavors were yum.  Anytime we are planning to shop at Trader Joe's and need some tasty lunch, we will keep Thai Thai Noodle in mind.
author: Maile N.

description:
OK!  I hate being that Yelper who keeps changing her mind.  But they came through for me in a pinch.  And it looks like they were able to iron out their flaws.

In fact, when I was sick in bed with the flu, they went above and beyond for me by delivering outside of their normal delivery timeframe (it was early afternoon, and I was very sick).  The order was correct and really good!  I just wish they still used the old recipe for their fresh vegetarian spring rolls.  Still, they've won me back!
author: Karen R.

description: I usually go here for lunch and it's my favorite spot in the area.  They have pretty large portions for a reasonable price so if you're not hungry, I recommend sharing or taking a to go container.  My faves are the samosas, yellow curry with chicken, and Pad See Ew.
author: Yolonda G.

description:
Must have again:
- bbq chicken fried rice
- garlic catfish

Okay
- duck red curry

4 stars
author: Leland F.

description:
Decided to come here again, because I suspected my first experience was poor mostly because I didn't order the right dish for me.

The lunch special is incredible. appetizer, soup, salad, and entree for 12.95, and it's all fresh and delicious.

The fresh spring rolls are some of the best I've had. They have the right balance of ingredients(usually there's too many noodles in fresh spring rolls for me).

All in all, definitely worth a visit.
author: Ben P.

description: I'm sad because I have ordered Pad Thai from Thai Thai Noodle and both times it tasted horrible. I get about 5-8 bites in before giving up. There is NO flavor and I can't tell if it is because the recipe has changed or because it has been sitting in some pot for hours and the sauce has gone to the bottom. Either way, I haven't ordered from here since February.
author: Sara J.

description: Omg you have to try one of the best places I have been for Thai food delicious crab fried rice and coconut ice cream was to die for nice and cold but very sweet as well great experience
author: Alexis P.

description:
I've been trying to diet since vacation is over, but I've been craving for Fried chicken w/ fried rice Thai style. Luckily Thai Thai Noodle is a block away from my job so I can get some. I've been avoiding this place ever since its open because its not part of the diet system LMAO but I've been here 3 times already and found the place A-OK. I've seen a lot of residents from the neighborhood come here for lunch or dinner, which makes a plus for them. Any who, back to my to go meal~ I decided to treat myself and get the fried chicken. Just the taste of the crunch and batter on the chicken made my cravings go away with the fried rice. It wasn't bomb or anything like Crab fried rice but Mediocre. I only ate half of it though so I can let my daughter try it out. I'm sweet huh? hehehe 

But ya the only thing I can complain about is that its slight greasy, and the restaurant itself doesn't look neat inside compared to the first time I ordered food here.
author: Kathy V.

description: This is the second Thai restaurant I've been to and they did not disappoint.  I stopped by for lunch with a colleague, and ordered the P3 for lunch.  Ordered it spicy, and it was perfect.  It had just the right amount of spice, along with delicious flavor.  If your in the knob hill area, definitely check them out.
author: T M.

description: Last night I went to one of my regular places and thought I'd try something new. It was awesome. By far the best tasting dinner I've had in months. Thanks Thai Thai, the Noodle Curry Chicken (#C8) was really, really good.
author: Travis N.

description:
Had a nice meal without the real authentic Thai experience. Great service and a good menu range and we left with that chilli taste on the back of the tongue. 

Appetisers were great but the green curry beef was uninspiring. 

Would recommend ordering appetisers first and then ordering mains when you are ready as food is prepared fresh and fast immediately.
author: Stuart R.

description: Just saw one of the employees eating at the bar and then picked his teeth with his fingers and then touch peoples plates. Gross. Put me off my food.
author: paul b.

description:
This place is totally disgusting.... Not for the food that I didn't try because of the greeting I received, but for the service. I have family in town visiting and my elderly disabled mother in-law needed to use the bathroom. I was clearly told no and had to pay the $10 just for them to allow her to use it!?!?!?!?!? 

Absolutely discussing service DONT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT
author: Matthew S.

description:
There are so many Thai places around the area, but I don't think I'll be going to any others. Thai Thai has pretty standard food that gets the job done. 

Good things:
- Diverse menu: There are tons of options here, from noodles to curries to rice plates and more. I like having options.
- Brown rice: I haven't come across too many thai places that offer will substitute brown rice for white in a fried rice dish, but I like that Thai Thai is health conscious here (even though the Pineapple Fried Rice looks like curried rice when it's with brown).
- Inexpensive prices: When you pay more than 9 bucks for a noodle plate, it's way too much. Thai Thai has good prices so no complaints here.
- Hot, hot food: Every time I've come, my noodles have been so hot that I had to wait until it cooled before I dug in. It's as if it comes right from the stovetop and into my hands (as it should be).
- Awesome service: All the waitresses here are super nice and always quick to fill your glass of water :)

Not so good things
- Rice noodles: This is a minor complaint, but the flat, white rice noodles are a little too soft for my liking.
- Portion sizes: The prices are cheap, but for a reason. The plates here are a tad smaller than other Thai places, like barely enough to cover two small meals.

You'll most likely never spend over $10 on a plate for yourself here and the food is pretty good. Super convenient and worth it!
author: Shira C.

description:
Great fresh spring rolls. 
Clean and modern feel. Phase Thai is really good as well. Large portions. 
Nice servers.
author: Rick J.

description: The decor is cute but the food was just so-so, towards the lower end of all the Thai food I've had. Not a memorable experience but filled my stomach and was close to the bars.
author: Trish P.

description:
I ate at Thai Thai today and had the worst experience.  I ordered the shrimp rolls for an appetizer and the shrimp were like rubber bands.  They were awful!

I ordered the Pad Thai for an entree and asked for no bean sprouts.  The food came out with wilted brown lettuce, undressed and of course bean sprouts.  I picked the bean sprouts out because the waitress (Kate) ran away before I could say anything.  She came back after I had picked out the bean sprouts and took the brown lettuce off my plate, she came back.  She asked if everything was ok when she finally came back.  I said, there were bean sprouts on my plate and in the entree and asked if she would eat this brown lettuce?  She said, "oh sorry" and walked away.  

I took my credit card out and set it on the table, she brought the check, fully charged for the rubber shrimp, brown lettuce and bean sprouts I didn't want.  I wouldn't come back to this restaurant!  I should have known better when I sat down and there were filthy napkins tucked under the legs of the table to keep it level :-((
author: Greg M.

description: Hits the spot for late night Thai, it's decent but not anything to write home about. The late hours make it better than average though. Quick online ordering and pickup too.
author: Tony P.

description:
Delivery was supposed to take 45 minutes - 1 hour.  2 hours later still calling them and they say "the delivery guy is on the way". 

If you want, go sit-down to eat here the food is fine. If you order delivery, good luck
author: Donald P.

description: If you wanna get the great authentic Thai food I would recommended this place. Service was excellent they always go extra miles. You will love it for sure.!!!!!
author: Sorakh S.

description:
Wanted to love this place, as it's just a couple blocks from my house. And truth be told, I'll probably be a repeat customer.

But even though the restaurant itself is pretty cute (modern decor, friendly service, dim lighting), the food is fairly average.

My friend and I shared the following:
- TOM YUM SOUP = Sour and yummy, but a bit oily.
- PAD THAI = While I appreciated that it wasn't overly sweet (a common mistake), it was pretty bland. Still chock full of chicken and veggies though.
- CHICKEN LARB = This was the dish that really disappointed me. Perhaps I've just been spoiled by Marnee Thai's rendition? I was expecting a dish that is wet, sour, spicy and flavorful; Thai Thai Noodle's chicken was somewhat dry and seriously lacking lettuce.

Prices are standard for the neighborhood. Will be back, but next time I'm avoiding the larb!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
This is my go-to for Thai takeout.  I like it because it's:
1. fast - always ready in 10 minutes and I never have to wait once I get to the restaurant (which would defeat the purpose of ordering take-out)
2. cheap - all the noodle dishes are $8.75
3. open late - open til 1am on weeknights
4. tastes good - tried most of the noodle dishes and the green curry and liked it all

The only con for this place is that they have a $10 minimum for credit cards, which is awkward because most of their dishes are less than $10.
author: Gloria N.

description:
Came for dinner, not expecting much but it was quite delicious.

Papaya salad had just the right heat, citrus, and sweet balance.

The soft crab special was devine!

And they have fresh coconut....wait for it....from an actual coconut so you can enjoy the water AND eat the yummy coconut flesh!

Very happy and will definitely be back!
author: Lev E.

description:
I was visiting this lovely city & had an amazing dinner elsewhere my wife saw this Thai restaurant  & I told her we were almost back at our hotel, so she wanted dessert!
Biggest mistake was not checking the dessert before leaving!
I can only talk about the dessert or the lack of a quality dessert!
Mango sticky rice you either sell & serve a great product or pull it from the menu as it states it's seasonal!
Well they should have not sold sticky rice it was cheap and subpar!
The square of rice was a flat 2 X 2 literally square of rice!
The mango was not a bright orange but a dull brownish orange w/dark spots!
I an disgusted & will be glad to never see this restaurant ever again!
I can only imagine the food they are serving here!  UGH Disgusting dessert!
author: Diego S.

description:
We ordered via seamless. The restaurant took an hour and a half to deliver. When we called to ask about the delivery time, they were quite rude. When our food finally came, our noodle dish had NO NOODLES, our curry dish that was supposed to come with rice had no rice, our 10 dollar fried pumpkin has only zucchini, and lastly everything was cold---not lukewarm---but absolutely cold. 

Thankfully seamless was the one to refund our order and very apologetic. This one star was really for them.
author: Cara M.

description:
This place is Thai Thai tasty. (Sorry; couldn't help myself)

It may not be the most amazing Thai food I've ever had, but there's all the trappings of a good local take-out joint. The service is prompt and friendly, the dishes well spiced, and it's really not that expensive for SF. I was with a party of four, and with four dishes and a papaya salad our bill was ~$67, including tip.

The pineapple fried rice was a bit disappointing, but everything else from the Thai Thai spicy beef to the Pad See-ew was great.
author: Nick S.

description:
The mediocrity of this place is impressive in its consistency.
Food is below average and over priced for what it is.
Staff is nice and they stay open late, big pluses.
author: Isley T.

description: One of my local go-to Thai places.  Not as stellar as my favorite few place down the hill, but if I'm closer to Thai Thai when I need my pad see ew and thai iced tea fix, it does the trick.  Worth a visit, or pick-up for take-out.
author: Christine K.

description:
First and most likely my only visit was a couple weeks back after a GS Warriors game approximately 11PM. We sat down to get a quick meal before going out after the game and decided to try this place out because how close it was to our place. WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!! Yelp should include negative stars!!!

Food was ok, nothing to write home about but I would have gone back due to pure proximity to where I live.

Time comes to pay the bill and I pull out my debit car.
Waitress,"No VISA for first time customers!"
ME:" wait what?"
Waitress: "No VISA for under $15."
ME:"ok," I pull out a $10 bill to pay for my $9 pad thai. A $20 falls out.
Waitress: "No, I see more MONEY!"
ME: "Excuse ME?!"
Waitress: "YOU PAY tip."
MY GF: "YOU CANNOT DEMAND A TIP!" I had planned to leave a $2 tip on my card
ME:"I was going to leave you a tip on the card but you shouldn't demand a tip from a customer, that is ludicrous!" I give her the $10 and pull $1's out of my back pocket and more money falls to the floor.
Waitress:"I didn't know you were going to do that, you can use your card!!"
ME:"No, actually I'm just going to pay and leave. Thank you for a great story and a great YELP review." I left a dollar on the table as well as the dollar change she never gave me."
author: Zach K.

description:
Had the standard Chicken Pad Thai. Was tasty and filling. Nothing extraordinary, but good. I would recommend eating in (as I always do with Thai) because the noodles will gel together if you wait too long to eat it.

If you're in the area and craving Thai, it's worth a shot.
author: David M.

description: Delicious Drunken Noodles! Extremely fast service for pickup and just as wonderful at home as in the restaurant. Spice is perfect and true to indication (mild, medium, spicy, etc).
author: Jenna B.

description: Stumbled upon this gem while out thrift shopping. We had the shrimp green curry garlic noodles, panam tofu, and basil chicken. All excellent and the staff were very sweet. They even had fresh coconut juice that came in the coconut. A little pricey but so worth it :)
author: Jessica F.

description: Food was good... Service not so much. I didn't tip well and the woman waiting my table basically through my tip back at me and told me she didn't want it. Lol smh! Never eating here again. Awkward
author: Danielle S.

description:
I recently went back last week, 
ordered pad see ew and within ten minutes, 
i started getting food poison reaction. 

so disappointing thai thai.

i really liked you.
author: Christine K.

description: Best cashew chicken I've ever had! It's a great price, and they really nailed it with the sauce. Don't get it with sticky rice though, or maybe I just don't get how to eat it properly lol.
author: Matt M.

description: Completely uninspired fare. The Tom Yum soup was pretty awful.  Has that unmistakable feel of a place just phoning it in.
author: George S.

description: Usually the waiters here are nice, but I have to suffer a rude Thai waitress today. She yells "what else?" When I order second item. She spills water on my table and repeat " tips are not included" when asked for bill. The guy next table suffers the same thing and he and me just can look at other without saying a word. I can't believe the owner hire somebody like this to work in the service industry. I hope she is not the owner.
author: Tiger V.

description: I've only had a glass of wine here;), but menu looks great. Clean and spacious seating--great location if you live in Nob Hill.
author: Mel G.

description:
Noodle noodle.

Thai food yes. But what's worth repeating are the noodles.

Side of steamed rice noodles was simple, clean, versatile and delicious. Mixed with chicken. Eaten along. Fuel for a long night of dancing ahead. Just $2.50.

Chicken satay was good but not noodle good. Portion was small for an almost $8 side. Could have used another skewer or two. 

Appreciated the offer of sweet and sour sauce when I declined the peanut sauce. Representative of the attentive and kind service throughout.

Service deserve a repeat saying too.
author: Jason B.

description:
I came here for lunch yesterday. The food here is pretty decent, packing lots of flavor. The Pad Kee Mao and the Pad Ka Praw was delicious. However, the Angel Wings were just OK, a little tiny and almost dry, though flavor was decent.
The server was really nice though. 
I think I'd definitely come back if I'm in the area.
author: Karen C.

description:
Worst experience of Thai food ever!

Sticky floor and the bench was so dirty when we went in at 6. There were only 3 people in the restaurant. 
We ordered papaya salad first. The food is not fresh. Papaya was so old. They left the squeezed lemon part in the salad. Then we found a big stem of herb. The herb leaf were used. Also one big chunk of useless end of cabbage in the salad too. I guessed that would make the salad look bigger. Tons of sugar without any flavor.

This is also the first item I had a Thai curry dish without any curry flavor. Only sugar and water.
We also ordered Pad Thai fried noodles. The chicken is so dried. The bean sprouts are so old. The vegetables are not fresh.....and again, no flavor at all. Totally plain. But you can taste tons and tons of sugar.

We just had to leave. 

Their prices are more expensive than other Thai restaurant in town. If you offer great food, then I would love to pay for it. But the food had no flavor and NOT even FRESH !
author: Bruce T.

description:
I used to like this place but then they made some changes.

Food: average
Price: higher than before
Portion: smaller than before
Menu: they cut some of the best options such as side soup, etc.. And reduced variety ( pretty disappointed) 
Service: ok 

Probably I won't come back...
author: Alex H.

description: Thai Thai is always a go to for me and my roommates. We live in the neighborhood so it's convenience is definitely a factor but the food is pretty good too. Been there for dine-in and takeout and same experience for both. My go to is the Pad Eggplant with tofu - great flavor and large portion, can definitely get two meals worth. It is filled with peppers and onions too. A bit oily but that can be overlooked.
author: Jillian C.

description: Worthless - closed a half hour earlier than was posted, not willing to accommodate take-out past 11:30pm
author: Robert M.

description:
Kraft macaroni & Thai. Eh. I've cooked better thai food myself, drunk. Zero spice. Can I get some cilantro/coriander/basil anywhere on any dish?
Totally weak. Feel guilty for having eaten it, but I was starving. And that says a lot. Doesn't everything taste amazing when you're starving?  This didn't.
author: Melissa H.

description:
food is good for a standard thai place.  had the pad kee mao and the noodles were extra wide and coated nicely so they didnt clump together.
I want to give them 10 stars for staying open late!
author: Cole H.

description: This place is amazing :) I went in with low exceptions and was blown out of the water. The best bang for your buck is the lunch special for $12.95 you get a app., soup, salad, and a main course. well worth it! Also, they deliver so that is a big win!
author: Angel S.

description:
I would give this place a solid 3.5 stars. This is not a place I would go out of my way to eat at, but if you live at Nob Hill, this is a very conveniently located restaurant to eat at if you don't want to walk all the way down to Polk St, or just need a good late night meal!
I had the Green Curry Fried Rice along with some samosas and both were pretty 3.5 stars-ish. They were pretty decent, but I am probably going to be ordering other things the next time I come here (which is very unusual for me - I usually clamp down on a default order for every restaurant I regularly visit, and just blindly order that every I go there).
The service was fast and friendly, and they did not mind me reading stuff on my laptop while I ate (wish they had wi-fi).
author: Aditya M.

description: When friends come to visit and ask where they should go, Thai Thai Gourmet is my recommendation. I've been going here since they served late night food in 2011, and their food is amazing. Once a week we get pad see ew and the panang curry and it's seriously PHENOMENAL. Great service, incredible stew beef in the curry! Seriously an underrated dish but it's so tasty here. The service is fantastic and the food is unbeatable. As someone who loves eating out in all of SF's best restaurants, i can't get enough Thai Thai!
author: Casey M.

description:
they have a creative menu with daily specials along with the traditional Thai noodle and rice dishes.

However, I stayed with the basics and got the beef curry fried rice and chicken pad thai for take-out.  Both meals were put on top of foil inside the plastic container, good since it was very hot when I picked it up (no thank you to melted plastic in my food).

the curry fried rice had lots of spices and curry in it, very tasty.  The pad thai was just okay, nothing amazing but then again, its just pad thai.  I'll have to go back and try their noodle specials and daily specials, pumpkin curry sounds yum.
author: Kevin W.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Pad Kee Mow
2.) Pad See Ew = Both of these dishes were good but nothing special
3.) Pad Prik King = mm tasty . . . green beans with rice


SERVICE:
Not bad


ATMOSPHERE:
Contemporary interior design, small, small bar seating with few beers on tap

9.10
author: Angela L.

description:
We came up to this Thai noodle location before hitting up groceries at Trader Joe's. In an attempt to try something aside from my standard Pad See Ew or Pad Thai, I decided to try a Thai curry for my first time (don't ask, I tend to shy away from curry in general for some weird reason!)

The restaurant wasn't busy and we were seated quickly. Placed our order and within 5 minutes had our food out in front of us! 

Overall, it was good Thai food. My curry had a bit of kick to it that wasn't obvious from the menu, my friend's dish was originally not as hot as he would have expected, but it caught up to him eventually and he said it definitely had some good heat in it. 

We polished off our food, got the check pretty quickly, and headed out. For two people, it was a good price and worth going to while we were right in the area. I would definitely check it out again if I wanted some decent, well-priced Thai.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
went to norcal for the weekend and while we were waiting for some friends to finish dinner we decided to grab a quick bite at thai thai noodle... best decision of the night.. i love thai curry and i'd never seen pumpkin curry before.. we ordered the pumpkin curry with duck.. pay the extra $2 for duck. i love duck it's delicious.. and also the pad see ew (beef).. they were both good.. my favorite of the two would be the pumpkin curry.. if you're there and you're getting curry make sure to get that one.. 

.. for dessert we couldn't help but get the sticky rice with mango.. yummmy.. 

the reason this place gets four stars can be justified by this fact: the same night when we finished bar hopping we went back to thai thai noodle for more food.. i didn't eat gain cause i was too full but i did try their ice coffee and thai teas.. pretty standard in taste.. there was a creamy consistency to it too if some people like their drinks milkier.
author: Jessica H.

description: Really great thai food.  Friendly staff.  Nice ambiance.  Definitely recommend.
author: Brian B.

description: You call this food? I can't believe this place is still in business. The food is not fresh and the worst part is that the curry had zero flavor. No complaints about the service- that's why there is one star. :)
author: Jessica F.

description:
Had lunch here yesterday because it was across street from trader joes.  I'd give it 3 1/2 stars. It was good, not great

Had the pad see ew and the fried rice with chicken. This iced tea and coffee.

It was empty the whole time

Took the muni one up Sacramento and down Clay
author: Foodlover B.

description: I die for the Tom Yum soup. I get it for pick up at least 4 times a week. Seriously amazing :)
author: Morgan H.

description:
Flavorful Thai food.  Popular prices.  Clean, but slightly sparse decor.  Thai Thai is good good!

Ordered my usual, Pad Ma Kuer (eggplant with meat + rice for $7.45), and got it with chicken which was plentiful, tender and tasty.  I mean more chicken than eggplant plentiful!  Which is hardly the norm around town.  The eggplant was cooked perfectly, as were the onions and peppers frolicking in well-balanced, but not quite exceptional  sauce.  

Friendly service, super-fast food delivery to your table.  I wish there were a Thai Thai Noodle in my neighborhood.  Hey, owners!  Do ya know the one thing we're missing in Temescal?!
author: Ted R.

description:
San Francisco in october is cold and I was hungry!  I walked by this place and saw their I love yelp sticker. They are more prominent in the US. So in I went.

Not to die for, but the pad Thai was good. I especially like the noodles. I found the chicken dry, but they gave you a very generous amount. In fact, the whole dish was very very generous in size. Prices are around $10 and can probably feed 1.5 to 2 people. After trying some more places, I probably would come again.
author: Robin D.

description:
I was really happy when I tried their food and thought to myself, "Yay, no more cafeteria food every day for me." I work a block away at a hospital and was getting tired of its food. My options around this area were very limited, to say the least.

Thai Thai Noodle has an extensive menu, but I must say I order the same dish almost every time, because it is simply amazing. I eat the eggplant dish with beef over brown rice. I dislike the basil, so I always ask them to remove it. Every now and then they forget to, but are always very gracious when I take it back. (Basil=Yuck!) 

Also, I love it that they are open until 3am on the weekends!
author: Monique T.

description:
Thai Thai Noodle is a brand new Thai restaurant that opened maybe about a month or so ago. 

I ordered a chicken pad thai to go for lunch before heading back to the office. The noodles were pretty good, flavorful and the chicken was not dry (thank goodness). They also granted my request to overcook the beansprouts- I cant stand the taste of raw or not fully cooked beansprouts!

 I'll be back.
author: M W.

description:
I came here after randomly walking down Hyde looking for a spot to eat.  When we walked in, the people were friendly and seated us, but it took a while to get some service (and they were out of Sapporo draft!).  When we finally placed our order, I got the Beef Salad and my buddy got a Chicken Thai Noodle Soup.  They brought his dish out in a somewhat timely fashion, but didn't even bring a spoon for his broth.  At least 10 minutes went by before they brought my salad out to me.  Honestly, how long does it take to throw a salad together.

When it finally arrived, I almost wish it hadn't.  The beef was WAY over marinated, and it seemed like they poured all of the left over marinade on the salad as the dressing.  After eating the top layer, I got to the middle and bottom portion of my salad and by that time, everything was swimming in a salty marinade that they thought was a salad dressing.  I couldn't even finish it.

Now I don't usually order a salad when I come to a Thai restaurant, and maybe their other food is better, but this dish and the slow wait to get my food will lead me to check out a lot of other places before I come back here.
author: Brent B.

description:
The Pork Belly dishes are dynamite!!! Can't go wrong with anything that involves Pork Belly, so yes that is my go to item.
The spicy catfish is also worth mentioning as it has some really great flavors going on in that dish.
author: June B.

description:
The average Thai corner restaurant.

This place is decently priced, open late, and has the typical items on the menu.  I wouldn't say it was the best, and I wouldn't say it was the worst.  I will become part of the permanent SF rotation, merely because it's close by.

- Pad See Ew: A large portion, that wasn't too oily and over run with bamboo shoots.
- Tom Yum: Average and refreshing.
- Thai Basil Rice: I am addicted to Thai Green Curry, hence the list.  They have a pretty good thai basil fried rice. It has a nice kick to it, and was definitely the better things that I ordered from here.

Overall, these people are nice and the food comes out pretty quick. Takeout is fast too.
author: Natalie G.

description:
I come here every so often because it's convenient for me. I have tried so many things on their menu, pan-fried noodle, curry, rice plate and dessert. I would say their pan-fried noodles are only so-so because it's pretty inconsistent, sometime it would be really good, sometime its ok. The curry never fail me though, so that's good. The rice plates I tried are so far so good.

I brought my friends here on different occasions and all of them compliment the tastiness (mostly rice plates).

Dishes I would not order again: Curry Noodles, just a weird combination for me, Papaya Salad, tooooo vinegary for me. *updated 1/14* Do not get the duck curry. It's a pretty big disappointment for me. The curry is toooo liquidy and I would say the duck flavor overpower the curry, which means it has no curry taste. Definitely will not order duck curry again.

I would suggest people not to order online because they did not receive my order placement last time I went. So better call in or eat in.
author: May K.

description:
Pineapple Fried Rice, you are amazing. 

Seriously this restaurant is soooo good. Since it's near Polk, you can  walk by on a Friday night and see people passed out on their table, and the waitresses apparently don't care. Hilarious. But everything I've had has been really tasty. It doesn't look like much from the outdoors...or even indoors, but I love it.
author: Sonya D.

description:
Here's an actual review and not some person who gives a three star rating without even trying the food.

It may be tough to compete with some of the other Thai spots on Polk street, but this place is close enough to my house to warrant a shot. 

Anyone who know Thai food, knows that a Thai restaurant is only as good as it's duck noodle soup (which I ordered with the flat rice noodles).  The first thing I noticed was that the ingredients seemed very fresh, which is not a surprise as today was their grand opening, however kudos for that.  There was just enough duck in the soup and it was cooked perfectly.  The other ingredients were just as well done.  Sadly however, the broth was lacking in flavor or character.  It may take a few months before they really hone that broth flavor in.  Maybe they were a little too worried about overwhelming customers with the taste and decided to back it off?  I dunno, however, since the broth is really the rug that ties the soup together I have to deduct a couple stars. 
  
Broth aside I am very excited that a new place has opened in the two block radius of Cala Foods.  Inga Donut and Dragon Chinese have really been dragging down the block with their awful food.  I would eat here everyday rather then go to either of those places.
author: Tony S.

description:
Ahh my favorite local thai place! I have been coming here quite frequently from the time I moved to this area, which has been a year and a half ago. I know that I can always depend not only on excellent food but really good customer service. They are very attentive to their customers and take care of each order with thought!  
I highly recommend this place! They recently reconstructed the restaurant making it very modern and chic. I always love coming here and bring guests and family who come to visit me in SF. This is also my #1 recommendation to anyone who lives in our Nob area. :)
My favorites here are pad thai, yellow curry, and green curry with shrimp. YUMMM
author: Yuliya K.

description:
I've eaten here a couple of times (take-out only) and I'd have to say I love it. They so convenient and quick. My best friend ordered food for delivery one night when we were up studying late and ever since then, I've always requested us to get food from here. 

I LOVE their Kaw Soi (Curry Noodle Soup) with chicken or tofu. It's like eating slightly more watery curry with noodles. I still crave this ever so often and it sucks because I live all the way in SJ. I've especially good on a cold night and you just want something hearty and warm in your stomach.  I've tried several of their other menu items and all have been very good. 

They have a very easy online ordering system that you can use and the food gets delivered quick and still hot. I highly recommend this place.
author: Vi L.

description: There aren't many thai restaurants serving Chicken Khao Soi, but Thai Thai Noodle is one of them! I was ecstatic when I found out considering this is my favorite dish! Overall good food and good service. They also do take-out.
author: Joffrey F.

description: Solid, cheap, dependable. Thai Thai Noodle is the perfect neighborhood Thai Restaurant. Their curries are flavorful (Massamun & Pumpkin Red are personal favorites) and when you ask for spicy, you get it! Try the Green Beans with Chili & ground Pork for some great flavor. The service is fast and friendly and they seem to do a strong take-out business. I will eat here again for sure, as it reminds me of the food carts in Krabi, fresh, spicy and all for a great price. Thumbs up for Thai Thai Noodle.
author: G C.

description:
Very solid thai food.  

The coconut curry rice with vegetables was really good and the veggie delight over rice was good.  I reheated my rice leftovers and they were only okay, but, when is rice reheated as leftovers ever good?

It was inexpensive, very quick, and not too heavy on the gut.  I would go back.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: I used to love coming to Thai Thai, especially given it's late hours, but the restaurant recently switched owners. The food no longer has a great flavor, the pad Thai sauce is dull and bland. The calamari is soggy and lacking in flavor as well, I wish the new owners would of kept the same quality of flavor and food as the last folks.
author: Ali H.

description:
For what it's meant to be - quick and hot food, this seems to be a great place to go so far! Inexpensive ($7 for a noodle plate) and fast, and the food comes out piping hot (which was fantastic on a windy night in the city). Went in with a friend and we tried the pad see ew and the pad kee mao, which complemented each other wonderfully since one is a bit eggy & sweet and the other quite flavorful and spicy.

The portions are well-sized and it's nice and clean inside for a fast neighborhood joint.
author: Rachel M.

description: Have done take-outs and dine-in. Friendly staff with great quality tasting Thai food here. Vegetarian friendly.
author: Hems B.

description:
The one day I strayed away from my favorite dish, my taste buds paid dearly. My tongue resisted the ginger fried rice, but lost to my wallet's cheapskate wail which made me finish the mofo. 

Kra Praw Moo Krob - this is for you. Oh crispy pork belly in generous portions, you light up my weekend life. A day at work when I conveniently forget my lunch at home, my lazy ass will make that block-long walk for you. The green beans and bell peppers are merely your background dancers, you are my superstar. I'll never stray again, I promise.
author: Nga B.

description:
Decent Thai Place that's open late and delivers (They only charge $1.50 for delivery!) 

I got the Pad See Ew with chicken, Pad Ke Moa (drunken noodles), sticky rice with Mango and Thai tea. Everything was good and flavorful. Only thing was it was a bit oily/greasy. Good portions except they gave so little sticky rice with the mango. 

Overall, Fast and prompt delivery, cheap, and tasty food. Would come back and use their delivery again if I'm feeling lazy and in the area :)
author: Linda N.

description: 2 items on a manic monday: (1) Por Sod appetizer: fresh-tasting spring rolls with tofu. It arrives with your common peanut dipping sauce. I felt healthy eating them. (2) Mango Salad: I like this dish except that the dressing is extremely salty. If they tone it down with the fish sauce, then it would be great. They serve the salad in this square-bowl, and the dressing collects on the bottom like a tiny pond. Otherwise, the shrimp was cooked just right, without being overly done or rubbery. This place is clean, with a friendly staff. It's on the corner of California and Hyde, so you can see cable cars whizzing by, with the cable-car conductor waving his hand and telling tourists to wait for the next trolley.  Such entertainment...
author: Derek N.

description: I had the worst experience at this place. I was walking home from school around 11pm, craving some pad Thai, so I decided to stop by here. I ordered pad Thai.. I asked for mildly spicy, and it would completely tasteless. I asked them if they could make it a little spicier and they brought it back burning hot (still with no taste, only heat and spiciness) my mouth was on fire and I was literally crying and sniveling. Worst Thai food experience, I'm never coming back!
author: Gabi A.

description:
I ordered the chicken satay because the girl on the phone said she loved it and I ordered the drunken noodles because I had a hangover, but hadn't lost my sense of humor. 

They were not good. 

And my expectations were low.

The drunken noodles were really wide and ridiculously doughy and greasy. The peanut sauce for the chicken satay would have been completely bland were it not for being overly sweet and tasted like oily peanut butter.  

The second star is for their willingness to take advantage of the fact that I'll forget how bad it is some night at 1am and go back and they will still be open at that hour.
author: P J.

description: Ordered tom kha chicken soup and BBQ chicken.  The soup's broth was tasty.  The rice was slightly mushy.  I wasn't a fan of the chicken in either dish.  Friendly delivery service.
author: Spencer B.

description:
The food flavor is good, quality is not always up to snuff and they can NEVER get the order right, it makes for a less than happy meal.

If I order the yellow curry with chicken, I get tofu and not chicken.
If I order my dish without onion (because they leave huge chunks of raw in your dish) I get extra onions.

Tonight my curry had mushroom (first time ever) when I looked closer  I saw they were on their way out, about a day past due if you are liberal with the food in your home kitchen, never what should be served in a restaurant. So they have old food and pass it off to a customer in a dish that doesn't even normally come with mushrooms.

Sucks that their flavors are good but their quality not.
author: Blue S.

description:
I'm basing this review on (a) my take-out experience and (b) my Pad Thai experience. Thai Thai Noodle, or TTN as it's henceforth going to be called, is a way more aesthetically-pleasing Thai restaurant than most of the other Thai restaurants located on every other block in this city. However, I was unable to experience it because I got my food to go. I think I'd enjoy the whole thing more if I ate in there with the cool modern, minimalist furniture. It's not Osha new-agey or anything. Just normal and nice and clean. Once that happens, I might be inclined to improve the rating, if it's still worth it.

Onto the Pad Thai, which I feel is the most cliche dish to order but also the best barometer. I've definitely had better, as this version contained basically no vegetables (I appreciate a carrot or broccoli inclusion to help cut the grease), but this one earns stripes for including bean sprouts and peanuts on the side. I also ended up eating an order of egg rolls, which were surprisingly light and noodle-filled. I'll be back here, hopefully with time to sit down and a star to add. I have to try the yellow curry, after all.
author: Stefanie L.

description: This was my go-to Thai place when I lived in Nob Hill. Fast take-out, reliable food, tasty. Nice to sit in as well but I think they do a lot of take-out.
author: Amy G.

description: Third time I've ordered delivery from here and I specifically ask for zero/1 star/not spicy food and it always comes as a 3-4 star. It's so spicy I can't eat it. I don't understand why they do this. I'm done with this place.
author: Jessica L.

description:
So I pass this place up quite a bit and every time I do I say to myself, "oh yeah, I need to check this place out."  Last night I was craving soup and while on my way to my "go to" pho place, I was stopped at the corner of Polk and California (red light) and remembered "oh yeah, I've been wanting to check out that place up the street" and viola, I found myself at the door step of Thai Thai determined to order the beef noodle soup.  Unfortunately I did not have enough cash on me (who carries cash these days?), and had to order more than I wanted to ($10 minimum).  In not reading the menu well, I assumed the shrimp roll was in fact a shrimp spring roll (for $8), so I used my debt card as payment and ordered extra (on their menu is a "veggie" spring roll - so I assumed they also had a "shrimp" spring roll).

In waiting for my order I anticipated the fresh shrimp spring roll with its tasty basil, bean sprouts, carrots and rice noodles dipped into a peanut sauce, and was fine with extra order (wasn't worried about eating extra calories as spring rolls are virtually caloric free); and yeah, $8.00 is a bit much for a shrimp spring roll, but I'm a sucker, what can I say; I was hungry.

While at home I opened up the greasy box and unfortunately to my surprise I found greasy shrinked up shrimp rolls that were completely tasteless (except for the grease) YUK!  I was totally not prepared for this and very disappointed.  Needless to say, I checked their online menu (which I noted each items prices to be $1.00 more than their actual restaurant menu prices (?)) and what do you know, there at the bottom of the appetizers listed "Shrimp Rolls = Marinated shrimp wrapped in egg roll wrapper, served with sweet and sour sauce."  I suppose I should have intuitively known it was FRIED - but I didn't.  Shame on me; but really, if the item is fried, ALL restaurants should put "deep fried" in the description as some of us are health conscious and avoid fried foods as if it were a death sentence.

As previously mentioned the Shrimp was so deeply fried I could not taste the "marinated" part an the shrimp was barely there (tasteless).  

Lastly, the Beef Soup was perfectly portioned and the broth/beef was tasty - so this was a plus.  I will certainly order from Thai Thai again, of course, with cash in hand and will also scrutinize the menu better.
author: Cris B.

description:
As a first-time visitor to San Francisco, I was looking for a tasty Thai restaurant not too far from my hotel (I don't live here, so I'm avoiding the hills as much as possible). At four (not too steep) blocks away, Thai Thai Noodle was the choice.

The restaurant has about a dozen or so tables, and I was able to score one with a window view. Service was very quick and very efficient: I had water and a menu about five seconds after I sat down.
