Since I checked their website before coming, I knew I was ordering the Pad Cashew Chicken with rice (this is my go-to dish at any Thai restaurant), and runs for less than $9 (plus the usual taxes/gratuities).

The dish arrived about five minutes later, and it was delicious. The sauce was wonderful, with a nice kick from the sweet chili. The chicken was breaded, which surprised me a bit, and started out okay but lost its crispiness the longer it sat in the sauce. The white onions and green peppers stayed nice and crispy, and the only thing the dish lacked was enough cashews (I don't consider five enough when the dish has "cashew" in the title).

Overall, though, very good experience, and my taste buds (and wallet) were very happy with my choice. (My legs thanked me too, when I took the trolley back up the hill instead of walking.)
author: Krista B.

description:
Food
-Pad se eww light on the sweet soy, but soft and a good sized portion
-Fried chicken friend rice, the rice is a bit bland but the chicken is moist and easy to eat. You must use the sweet chili sauce that accompanies it. It adds the perfect amount of sweet and sour to the dish
-BBQ chicken with fried rice, same bland rice as the fried chicken dish and the BBQ chicken is equally as bland
-yellow curry, not too bad... Bland as well

Service
-slow... Very slow... Often times painfully so
-there is no AC and no airflow so on a hot day they turn down the lights and give you extra napkins to fan yourself... It gets freaking hot in there
-decor, ikea

Overall, this place is convienent, mid priced... A little more expensive than most Thai restaurants...and not terrible
author: Minie J.

description:
Warning! My review is only of the service, as I was unable to eat their food... 

I was looking for late-night delivery and Thai Thai Noodle was one of the few that said they offered delivery at 1AM on Friday. Their website says that they deliver until 2AM on Fridays, so I happily placed my order online. They said to expect a 45-60 minute wait, so I forgot about it until 2AM when I realized I hadn't received any kind of confirmation. I called the restaurant, and they said that they had received my order but it was blank. 

...I was surprised that they didn't try to contact me in any way -- if I had waited for hours for food that never came, I would've been pretty pissed! But then they said that they did have my food -- for carry out. What? Apparently they did fill my order (I don't understand how, if my order was blank) but they didn't deliver that late. I told them that I had placed the order at 1AM, but they said that they stopped delivering at 12AM. I checked the website again and it CLEARLY says "delivery until 2AM on Fridays." I asked them about it again, but after I bugged her a couple of times, the woman on the phone said that their delivery man had left at midnight.

DO NOT try to order delivery from here past midnight. Apparently even though they advertise delivery until 2AM, they stop whenever their delivery man leaves. Also, they won't contact you if there's something wrong with your order.
author: Jackie C.

description: 3.5 but I was won over by the great service and huge portions. The food is yummy, quickly prepared and served piong hot. They have all the Thai food staples and my friends and I ate here twice this week since our friend lives down the block. Chicken satay, Pad Thai,Tom kee soup and the green bean salad were all yummy.
author: Erica Z.

description:
I can't believe another Thai place is going up in this area. There are already enough amazing Thai places within a 10 minute walk from this intersection.

Interestingly, this restaurant replaced an impending pizza restaurant that changed their minds, with post-recession recovery hopes looking low.

I will update my review once this place opens.

Update: I ate here yesterday and got the Pad Thai and it was surprisingly bland considering how the ingredients looked. 

The decor was standard contemporary 'Osha' look with no character. 

I might give it one more try with something more exotic.
author: Anthony K.

description:
I'm grateful to have this place near the Polk St bar action!!  As I may be making the new Wreck Room my usual dive -- Thai Thai Noodle will likely become my midnight go-to.

They are open late (2:30am on weekend), and unlike other late-night places, they are still very clean, well lit, and with pretty good service.

I like their menu as they have a variety of specials along with their standard dishes.  A special they alway seem to have is +$2.50 for a appetizer (soup, a spring roll, or a couple of chicken skeweres) with purchase of any entree.  I love tom-yum soup so I heart this deal.

Prices are very reasonable.  When I was there last Saturday, I tried their cod clay pot ($13.95) -- big chunks of butter dish with savory veggies and clearn noodles -- very delicious!  A typeical curry over rice will run you about $9.  They serve beer too (i.e. Blue Moon for $4) -- so you can keep the fun going :).
author: Kendra W.

description:
One star for late night delivery on a weekday and one star for edible food - otherwise, Thai Thai Noodle was nothing to write home about.

Delivery was quick and we were starving from our cross-country trek (+). The food was bland as all get out (-). We had the shrimp spring rolls - which were alright though the accompanying sweet/spicy sauce was the real winner.

My pad thai was edible, though the chicken was dry as all get out. My fella got a dish with mixed seafood and wide flat noodles. By the time the food had gotten to us, the noodles had amassed into a giant doughy ball. 

Online ordering was definitely a plus - though probs will keep an eye out for better thai.
author: Traci K.

description: Had the Fried Shrimp with egg noodles in a garlic shrimp sauce. Was very yummy! Might have to get it again next time after work!
author: Domonique H.

description: The pad thai and the curry dish we had there is below average. I didnt want to eat the left over the next day. This is a convenient location for us but we will not return again. There are far better Thai food place than this one.
author: H H.

description:
Only because they are one of the only places that serves khao soi.  

Fell in love with it in chiang mai, thailand and still in a search for a good place for it.  

This place isn't great by any means, but when you're having a khao soi craving it's just a few bucks before you have the sweet, spicy, pickled and fried crispies in front of your face.
author: Hannah W.

description: I can see why people think it's good, it's very tasty, but for an Asian's point of view they just put a lot of salt and spice into their dishes, while the spice and the saltiness just covered over what food is supposed to be like. I am dying of thirst just sitting here waiting for the check, this isn't a good sign for good food.
author: Jordan D.

description:
I've been here twice in the past and recall them being very generous with duck! If you order a duck fried rice or duck pad sew ew... you can expect 40% of your dish to be meat!  I prefer more of a 30% ratio =)  I like my carbs.

However, my 3rd visit was for a take-out order and it was disappointing.  I ordered a pad sew beef the other night and when I got home, I saw yellow-ish, grayish-green veggies throughout the whole dish.. clear indicator that the veggies were old and should not be eaten.  I didn't appreciate that.  The ugly and abnormal color was too obvious to be ignored so maybe the chef figured he could pull a fast one on a take-out order.  Overall.. the pad sew ew was bland and I didn't eat much.  

Food is (usually) decent, location is cleaner and nicer than other small Thai spots, but just be sure to give your order a lil peek before running off.
author: Beatrice T.

description:
Did a search of nearby restaurants in the area on Yelp! that offered option to order online and delivered late night dinner.  I had green curry shrimp with eggplant and jasmine rice.  I asked for mild flavoring and the other entree - pad thai with shrimp was supposed to be spicy.  They got the spice levels mixed up on both orders.  Our orders were delivered in less than the time they said it would arrive.

I was surprised that they didn't auto add in delivery charge.  They didn't bring any condiments (soy sauce, chili powder, etc.) so the other order that was supposed to be spicy ended up being quite bland.  I think I would've enjoyed my meal more if it hadn't been on the spicy side.  If the restaurant would've gotten the spice levels correct and offered condiments I would've given it a 3.5 star rating.
author: BustA G.

description:
To preface, my boyfriend loves this place. So whenever its his turn to pick the take out, we usually wind up calling Thai Thai Noodle. I have mixed feelings about this place, as my experiences have been mixed. Sometimes the food is off the hook good and other times I want to demand a refund. Specifically:

The pros:
- Ridiculously cheap. 
- Open late...I believe they close at like 1am on the weekends. 
- Super close to our apartment, although its sad for me to admit that we often pay for delivery rather than walking the four blocks (round trip)

The cons:
- Somewhat bland, although this goes back to the inconsistency. Some days its so perfectly spicy and good, others I feel like someone forgot to add the chili flakes to the drunken noodle dish. 
- Kind of greasy (all the time) 

Overall:
When laziness prevails, a late night food craving pops up or when the BF chooses the thai, it's a decent option.
author: Jenn G.

description: The food in here is decent, but overpriced. I've eaten here twice and felt sick both times after. My girlfriend felt the same. Won't be back!!
author: Robert A.

description:
I ordered for delivery so my expectations were not very high, but the food still fell short.  The duck in the Duck Red Curry was fatty and full of gristle, the curry itself was pretty standard.  The Tofu Pad Thai was starchy and flavorless like it was hardly seasoned and only very lightly cooked.  The Tom Kha soup was overly sweet.  You can get better thai from a frozen package.

Tack on delivery was 20min later than promised, not recommended.
author: Chris H.

description:
I've only been here once. My friends' dishes were tasty, but mine, Moo Yang (bbq pork) over rice, was disgusting. I recognize that the low review may not seem fair for one bad dish, but I question any restaurant that would even consider putting what I had on a plate, let alone serving it to a paying customer.  I would estimate that 60-70% of the bbq pork was fat, and instead of being seasoned with fresh herbs and spices as described, it was drenched in oil. Luckily, I had sweet chili sauce that I could mix into the white rice and eat. Topped off my rice with dessert (fried banana w/coconut ice cream), which was yummy. 

Another reason for more docked stars: between the four of us, we discovered (weren't even looking for it!) that we had been given 2 dirty plates and 3 dirty utensils. One soiled item, I can understand, but 5? They clearly aren't washing their items very thoroughly.
author: Jenny Z.

description: Amazing pineapple fried rice! Shrimp green curry garlic noodle was to die for as well. Must have again.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
My sister and I were leaving San Francisco after visiting our brother there for a few days. On our way out of the city, we wanted to grab a quick bite, but couldn't find a place that looked both promising and cheap.

After driving around the city for half an hour, we finally settled on Thai Thai Noodle.

Since Thai food can be unexpectedly expensive at some places, we were greatly relieved to find that the prices were quite affordable. We ordered the PAD THAI and the PAD KEE MOW.

The prices reflected the quality of the food well, I'd say; it wasn't spectacular, but it was still good. The portions were a good size; not humungo, but we didn't feel cheated. It was still a decent value for the money we spent. Since we were eating lunch at three in the afternoon, the place was pretty dead, but it was clean.

I can't say that I'm chomping at the bit to get back to SF so that I can go back to Thai Thai Noodle, but if I lived nearby, I'd probably find myself hitting it up when I needed a Thai food fix -- unless there's a better place nearby that I just don't know about because I'm an out-of-towner.
author: Jeena L.

description:
This place is open until 2:30 am! That is probably the biggest plus. They stop delivering at midnight though. I called in to place an order of 4 dishes around 1:30 am and they somehow had it ready when we went to go pick it up around 1:38 am. I don't know what that says about how the food was prepared, but okay... very fast. 

The food (from least favorite to most favorite):
Pad thai w/ chicken: weird looking and bland. My friend added soy sauce cause she wanted more flavor (I don't suggest doing that)
Fried rice: not much flavor either
Red curry w/ chicken: I asked for mild and it was mild, yet still had flavor, so that's good.
Pad see ew: this dish is actually decent. i guess it's hard to mess up when you have 3 main ingredients.

It's pretty much large portions of cheap not-the-best Thai food. If you are hungry and want food right away -- order from here! Or if it's late at night and you're slightly drunk and don't particularly care how good the quality of your food is, you should also visit this place.
author: Jessica W.

description: I think they may have changed owners. Regardless, they now close at midnight. Their late hours were really the only competitive advantage they had compared to the other Thai places in the area. I would much rather order delivery from either Modern Thai or Lers Ros.
author: Alyssa W.

description: The pad Thai was watery and almost inedible.  When I ordered on the phone for take out they didn't mention the $10 minimum for credit cards so I had to buy something else. Bad Thai overall
author: Jennifer R.

description: I ordered BBQ chicken with garlic egg noodles. It was delicious. My wife got Panang curry and she thought it was okay. We were hungry so we tried this place and came away satisfied.
author: Zack M.

description: I've been here many times over the past couple of years and it is one of my go to places in the neighborhood for Thai food. I like that their dishes are seasoned on the lighter side, the servers are nice, and the food comes quickly. When you are in the mood for a low key, no frills, Thai night in the neighborhood, this place hits the spot.
author: Jessie L.

description: I am from Thailand so I tend to be a little picky when it comes to Thai food.  This place has pretty decent food.  I always order this to go, they seem to prepare the food pretty quickly.  Really enjoy the Tom Yum noodle soup, the pad Thai is mediocre, but the pad see yu is pretty good.
author: Keri K.

description:
My local go to spot! I am a big fan of Thai so I instantly make this my local eatery.

I live a block away and it serves good cheap Thai food. I often walk down the hill with the intention of going t Calafood for groceries and abort and head here instead.

They have some pretty good deals on the specials board, though it is already pretty cheap. The staff are very friendly and the place is clean and quiet.

It is also perfect for my drunken walk home with late night opening and takeaway
Mon-Thu, Sun 11 am - 1 am
Fri-Sat 11 am - 2:30 am

Try and get the window table great place to sit eat and watch the world go by!
author: Chris M.

description: I get take-out dinner from here probably bi-weekly. I always get the green curry (with eggplant) and a side of rice. It is very good, with the right amount of spice. However, I wouldn't choose to go here with people, as the people who work there are not very friendly and it isn't a very comfortable setting. The food is quite good, though. So, this is your place if you are looking for quick and tasty Thai food.
author: Harmony P.

description: Took home the Duck Noodle Soup to my husband today. A little on the sweet side which he likes. He loved it. I am looking forward to trying more things on the menu
author: Linda C.

description: I've eaten here twice now, both after moderately heavy drinking session at Wreck Room. Both times I've gotten pork belly (with basil and most recently with oyster sauce and chinese broccoli) and both times I've been thoroughly satisfied. Tender, fatty pork slices with just the right amount of sauce, saltiness and teder crispy veg. Service was also very accommodating considering I've never actually dined here sober.
author: Anthony R.

description: Great food.  A little expensive.  It is Noe Valley, but still.
author: Matt W.

description: Good food.  Fast service.  Excellent coconut juice.  I would definitely go there, again
author: Virginia C.

description: So when did Cal Market turn into Trader Joe's?  I used to live up the street like the change.  Thai Thai Noodles is across the street, a small venue but we want at 1:00 and no problem sitting 10 people.  I would call this place very consistent Thai ...  but there was a special of Healthy Rice - Brown Rice, Spinach, Raisins, Cashews in a sweet sauce, try it.  Their Pad Thai is a wee bit spicy so heads up.  And their boiled chicken was not looking real good but tasted really good with the sauce.  Hey I take that back it is not consistent Thai it is unique Thai.  I will try this place next time and I will order ...  I did not get to choose.
author: Toby N.

description: This could be the freshest and best Thai food I have ever had. Wish I found it sooner!
author: Chris S.

description:
This is your typical Thai restaurant.  They have pretty good fried rice, and bbq chicken.  This is the closest place to my work, and my coworker and I go here pretty often.  Their service isn't so great, but it's not bad.  They aren't busy enough to have 2 waiters/tress, so most of the time there's only one person working.  I really like their food.

Their fried chicken fried rice, or bbq chicken fried rice is really good.
author: Amy A.

description: My only experience with Thai Thai is a 1AM pitstop while starving after a night out. The fact that it's OPEN at that time makes it 4 star worthy for me. I hate picking up late night pizza (or similar junk), so having a decent option nearby is more than a little exciting. A friend and I popped in, shared the spring rolls (pretty good), while I got the pad thai and she opted for a rice dish with peanut sauce for our mains. Our total came to around $25 and I was happy to pay it considering I didn't have to munch on greasy pizza at 1A AND I had leftovers for lunch the next day. The service was fine -- not overly attentive but since I wasn't really going for the experience, it didn't much matter. I would definitely go again -- maybe even during normal hours! :)
author: Shannon E.

description:
I want to say something: I think Polk St. is a crap hole. I don't know why. I love Miller's, I love that Big Apple Grocery is open on Christmas (an often overlooked merit of the Asian community), and Bob's and The Cinch have very near, very dear spaces in my artery-clogged heart. 

So why the animosity? Who knows? It's the cold I can't seem to shake. In spite of it all, I don't like Polk and probably never will. 

I'm glad that's off my chest, because now I can talk about Thai Thai Noodle, which is just fine, really. I've been there twice now, both times for take-out. The food isn't bad at all, it's ready in 15 minutes, and this place is open astonishingly late. Perhaps it's the fifty-something mentality of mine, but I nearly feel scandalized by a restaurant being open past midnight on a Sunday. Isn't this against the rules?... much like wet-farting on my couch, isn't this something that simply is not done?

I've had the Tom Kha soup, which I found lacked a bit of spice, and the Pumpkin curry, Panang curry, and Pad Thai, all of which were just fine. 

I guess it's much like the rest of Polk St. for me -- it'll do in a pinch, but I'm not writing home about it. But to be honest, I never write home because I'm unappreciative and a dickhead. So I guess that saying doesn't really work for me.
author: Brian K.

description: cockroach. on. the. table. Unfortunately it did not make its appearance until after we were finished eating.  Our waitress was nice enough to try to cover it with a plate in hopes that we wouldn't notice... and to give us a a halfhearted apology when we did.  We got the impression that she had a covered a roach or two before in her time there, and so we will not be returning.  Oh and despite having a roach-infested table, we were charged full price.  At least she offered us dessert... which we obviously declined. Dine here if you like extra protein!
author: Holly E.

description:
Ugh. I don't know WHO writes these reviews.. They must've had their taste buds surgically removed with a chainsaw. 

Got takeout late last night; price was good and it smelled amazing.. veggie eggrolls were great - off to a good start! eggrolls: 7.5/10

alas, it was not to be.

beef panang curry was decent - beef was OK and the sauce was kindof good. portion was way too small. 6/10

chicken pad thai was inedible - had a strange smell and almost fishy taste to it - how can you mess up pad thai?? the culprit was i think the tofu- nastiest i've ever had. yes, grant it it's not like i've eaten in thailand's slums but this stuff was B.A.D. bad. chicken was very very dry, totally papery and tasteless. 0/10

peanut sauce was more grease than sauce. looked disgusting and tasted like straight oil. 0/10

stay far, far, away.
author: Rob G.

description:
Lack of Flavor is the theme of this review. I really really wanted to like Thai Thai Noodle. Why? Because of love Thai noodle dishes. Pad Kee Mow, Pad Se Eew or Pad Thai. Love them. Unfortunately, TTN (my abbrev. for Thai Thai Noodle) wasn't that great.

The quality of ingredients is really good. Everything we had was made with good veggies, meat, starches but it fell short on flavor but just barely. 

Chicken Satay - juicy and tender meat. Not enough curry on the meat.

Fried Chicken Wings - I thought they that were really overcooked but my husband really liked them. I'd pass on them but that's me.

Pad Kee Mow - good amount of noodles to veggie, not too greasy but it needed salt and maybe some lime and spice. easy to fix with table condiments but still...

Crab Fried Rice - Also lacking in flavor but this time it worked. the flavor of the rice was so mild that you could really taste the crab flavor.  the rice was really fluffy and there were nice chunks of crab meat throughout. 

I may give it another try, being so close to my place but I think that Little Thai and Modern Thai are better.
author: Kiristen R.

description: I've eaten here a few times and have also called in orders for pick up.  Staff is always friendly and the food is always delicious with hearty portions!!!
author: Rosa A.

description:
I usually won't give a restaurant five stars until they have passed the eat-there-ten-times-without-disappointment test, and Thai Thai is no exception. Their pad Thai is like an antidepressant, their panang curry is like a woman, their Tom Yum is like a warm embrace and their vegetarian egg rolls are everything you could possibly imagine and more. They also have a million vegetarian options, great service and after dinner candies. All they need is a liquor license. 

I am very happy that Thai Thai moved into my neighborhood, and it won't be long before people start catching on, but at least I said it first (or sixteenth rather). 

I recommend that you stop what you are doing go there right now.
author: Ian T.

description:
Thai Thai Noodle is Americanized Thai restaurant. It's very good for the lunch and,casual dinner. The prices are very affordable.
I usually take to go; I had never stayed there to eat.
The food is very good - not the best quality - but definitly worth these money. Good big Portions.They even try to decorate it nicely - and it works for them!
Great Great Service: they are very fast and very sweet/friendly.
I also like that they are open late. 
If you go there once, you will always come back!
author: Jenna F.

description:
First visit:
I went here I got some soup and a pad thai. I didn't know you could make a pad thai be so boring. So lousy I would go as far as to say it was a top contender for the worst thai food I've ever had.

Second visit:
I went back a couple months later and got a curry. The previous chef must have been killed by an angry customer, because the food was greatly improved. Not amazing, but it was good enough to give one more chance.

Third visit:
I got a bowl of beef noodle soup with egg noodles. The soup had more meat than I could finish. Not bad, but the flavor just was not that interesting. Usually Thai food is pretty heavy on the flavor, but this seemed lacking.
author: Jordan M.

description: A little overpriced, but really decent thai food.  Awesome late  night after bars close!
author: Gina I.

description:
This place was surprisingly good. I just popped on in with just intuition and wow. I had the shrimp egg roll appetizer and they were the bomb. I was kind of sad that I only ordered 2. I should have ordered more! They were smaller egg rolls that were a bit bigger than the shrimp and fried nice and golden brown. Sauce was the bomb. And I like that they drizzled the right amount on top. No dipping necessary! 

As for the main dish, I went with one of the specials- Pad Thai with shrimps. That was the bomb too. Lots of flavor and good sized shrimps. 
The portions are huge so you better come HUNGRY.
author: Rob Y.

description:
In my experience finding decent Thai place is difficult although there are quite a bit of them, I find that most of them just do not take care to really give you good food. 
   
   I've been a Thai Thai Noodle several times, I find the price for the portions and quality pretty good, the service is generally fast and staff pleasant, the decor is alright. 
   
   I give it 3 stars because it generally stands out of all the other Thai restaurants I've tried and because it's a nice in-expensive decent place to stop by if you happen to run out of options in the city, this one delivers well on a consistent basis.
author: Benoît B.

description:
This place has decent food. What it has going for it is that is two things: First, it's open quite late, later than other Thai places in the neighborhood so we end up going there late nights for decent noodles. Second, it's across the street from my dry cleaners which I visit on a weekly basis.

Not sure I would go out of my way otherwise, but it is decent.
author: Storm C.

description:
This used to be delicious and cheap, but they raised prices, the food isn't as good.  They put curry in a paper box so it is almost evaporated by the time you get it home - just the meat/veggies, no sauce.  Which is kind of the point of curry...

Plus, they let you order online, but there is a minimum credit card charge - which the website does not say (even tho you tell it you are paying by card).  "But if you buy two cokes then it is over the amount."  But I don't want two cokes - I ordered exactly what I want.  That's how it works.  Disappointing.
author: Stacey R.

description:
This is my son's favorite restaurant. Shrimp roll, BBQ saute kabob are those always on the order.

We went there in month basis. Sometimes, twice a month. I think.
Food is freshly prepared. I've ordered red, green curry, eggplant dish (can't remember exact name), soup. All are good and fresh.

I like the draft beer Sapporo as well. (from tap)  
It's so close to us and convenient.
author: Gloria W.

description:
Since moving to San Fransisco, my greatest food discovery has been Thai. I'm completely obsessed and my newest discovery has been Thai Thai Noodle. Not only is their food delicious, they are open late and deliver late. 

Definitely try the Drunken Noodles! They are incredible. The curries are also very good. 

Their prices are another plus!
author: Jamie E.

description:
Thai Thai is a great Nob Hill neighborhood spot. I live around the corner and I come here so often, alone or otherwise, that my friends expect to come here every time they visit. The food comes out within minutes of ordering which makes me think it's prepared earlier in the day. But it always tastes so fresh and hot that I don't care. 

Hands down my favorite dish is the Drunken Noode with chicken. They don't skimp on anything -lots of veggies noodles and meat. It's inexpensive and quick, and with the interior upgrade, it's perfect for any kind of occasion.
author: Kamalpreet K.

description: So I was just there with some friends and everything was fine except for this crazy lady staring us all down like a hawk. She must have been an owner or something.. She kept walking behind the counter and talking with the wait staff but all the while had her arms crossed and the most awful look on her face. I've never had a problem with this spot, the food is good, prices are fine, atmosphere is pretty cozy, it's just this crazy lady who literally stared us down from the minute we came in till we left. Also we weren't badly behaved, obnoxious or anything, just trying to enjoy our dinner while being glared at. Weird experience, and definitely gonna look out for this lady again before deciding to go in.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Well, I am not an expert in Thai food as some of the other users and therefore maybe easy to please. However I absolutely loved what I ate at Thai Thai Noodle. The Shrimp Roll appetizer was prepared to perfection. The meat was succulent and incredibly flavorful,while the fried dough was crisp and not overpoweringly greasy, which is hard to get just right.

As a main dish I had the pumpkin Curry with shrimp, an incredible taste sensation, with pumpkin so rich and buttery, a few pieces filled me up like a whole meal. 

I ended up taking some left overs home and took a taste out of the box every now and then. It was so delicious that I felt good for hours after each bite.  

Friendly service and perfectly cooked food and enough to make me happy the next day.That's good enough for me.
author: Sketchbook S.

description:
I've ordered takeout here twice and I found it to be satisfactory both times. The first dish I got was chicken and it was average but tasty. The second dish I ordered was beef and I thought that tasted a little odd. 

I like that you can add half orders of appetizers onto your meals; I believe they do this so customers can reach the $10 credit card limit. 

Prices are good, the service is quick and friendly, and the environment is clean. There's a decent amount of seating, a small bar, and they are open late. 

I will order from here again :)
author: Stephanie D.

description: The food is delicious. I have been there several times.  I highly recommend the spicy catfish, the beef salad, and the massaman chicken curry. yummy:) The price is amazing. It is a great value. Portions are very generous. The staff gets a little overwhelmed  when they are busy, but they try hard. Will definitely keep going back!
author: Heather N.

description: Probably the best thai in SF. My favorites are the thai bbq chicken, boneless charbroiled goodness with chili sauce. The yellow curry chicken is awesome, perfectly cooked potatoes and carrots mixed with lots of tender chicken. Both the regular and pineapple fried rice are really delicious. Great service, quick delivery and good price points. An overall all around winner.
author: Timoteo K.

description:
Stopped in before touring a potential Nob Hill apartment.  Had my standby of red curry.

Delicious curry, great balance of chicken, and way more vegetables than I usually get in others' red curry.

Got the apartment, and super glad there's excellent Thai on my block!
author: Stephanie R.

description: Was expecting the usual Thai food, but it was delicious!
author: Sourabh B.

description: Pleasantly surprised! Pretty warm inside so we got it togo. But it was normally priced with decent portions. The food was of the better Thai that I've had. I would come back forsure.
author: Tasha O.

description:
The Duck Noodle Soup is an amazing hangover killer!!!

I woke up with a nasty hangover on Saturday and needed something in my belly. I was thinking about getting some sweet potato fries from Nob Hill Grill, but decided to walk up one more block and I'm glad I did so b/c the soup was epic.

Definitely one of my new favorite spots in the area...radical!!!
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
5 Stars because:
-huge portions
-fresh ingredients
-friendly & quick service
-late hours
-cheap prices

I probably order to go from here once a week roughly or will bring friends here.  Dishes that I would recommend are the Pad See Eew (flat rice noodle), Pad Ka Praw (for those who like spicy food), and the Fried Chicken Fried Rice is pretty good.
author: Irving Z.

description: This is our go-to Thai spot.  Very good value and fast.  I recommend the pad see ew with chicken or the pumpkin curry over rice.  Delicious!
author: Pat D.

description: Yummy!  This place was a good find.  Price, portion, and taste were awesome, highly rec.  Must try their mango salad.  It had this tasty coconut flavor which was new and exciting to my taste bud, never had a mango salad like that before.
author: Happi Y.

description: Five star for the combination of price and quality.  Walking past this place, I stopped in for some take-out on a whim, and ordered pad thai, pumpkin curry, chicken satay.  It was surprisingly good - larger portions and reasonably priced.  Tasted less greasy than most thai places which is a definite plus.  I'd go back more except we're moving in a couple of days.  Doh!!!
author: R H.

description: This place is the BEST!  Low prices...totally authentic cuisine...clean environment...and really friendly employees.  And fast.  I consider myself a bit of a thai food connoisseur...and I haven't found a better thai spot in the city yet!  4.99999 stars.  Simply because I reserve that last .01 star for a server tap dancing on my table.  The green bean salad is extra yummy...a fan fav.
author: Adrea F.

description: I love this place!  The food is great, service is efficient, and delivery is prompt.  Thai Thai Noodle has become my go to Thai when I'm lazy,   watching Harry Potter reruns on the Family Channel all day long and have no intentions to  leave my couch for food.  They always overestimate the time it'll take them to deliver which is great because then you aren't left wondering where is you food.  The quality of the food is great.  I have tried several dishes and curries and I liked and finished everything!
author: Pawanpreet G.

description: Ordered delivery from this place and 1.5 hours later was still without food. Called multiple times to check on the status of the order and received a busy signal. When we finally did get through to someone at the restaurant they were extremely unhelpful. We were told that the delivery man on his way and a half hour later still without food. The food isn't anything special and definitely not worth it. If you're looking for a decent delivery, go else where.
author: Dana N.

description: Neat little Thai restaurant sitting in Nob Hill. I got the Kao Tom which was good for a cold night. It's a rice porridge with mince meat. I thought it was a little under-seasoned and dull.but not going to be too critical because these items tend to be more clean and light. Tom Yum noodles are pretty good as well. Pretty authentic Thai restaurant that is great to eat anytime.
author: Ed L.

description:
This is a really fantastic Thai restaurant.  I wasn't sure what to expect since it only opened up recently, but it's great, and they're open really late!

One of the dishes I love is ground chicken with whole green peppercorns on the vine! The service is not intimate but it is friendly and quick.

Their  tom yum soup was a little strange but everything else has been really delicious.
author: Evie S.

description: Interesting and mouth-watering delicious! I recommend the TALAY PAD PONG KA REE.
author: Amity L.

description:
I love this Thai restaurant which is very close to my home.
The food they serve is delicious (especially their specialties written on the black board), it isn't expensive, and the service is fast and courteous.
I would definitely recommend this place, even though other Thai restaurants may have better curries.
author: Emilie N.

description: The coconut soup is really, really good. I had the sea bass clay pot and my mom had the chicken salad. Both were very good. Finally, the tea is free and really good.
author: saul j.

description: Fast delivery (20 mins); food was super hot and tasty. Ordered the Samosas, Tom Kha soup with chicken and Pad See Ew with tofu -- all good. $24 plus tip. Will order delivery again!
author: Emily B.

description:
Good food; been here a few times for take-out. Pad ke mau was a little oily but it tasted good and had a decent amount of veggies. Gai (chicken) satay was good - fresh chicken from the grill. Spicy calamari was good but wasn't very spicy.

Service was quick. Thai Thai Noodle is good for a quick bite on the way home or as a place to meet for a casual, local bite to eat that doesn't require a trip to the Tenderloin/Lower Polk.
author: Aaron B.

description: Great little thai place. They have one of the largest selections of soups I've seen, and wonderful apps. Even though they aren't Thai, the samosas are really good. LOVE their beef noodle soup. The duck dishes are really good, too.
author: Monika M.

description: Underwhelming.  Kinda dumbed-down, even though the menu looked great.  With a lot of great thai places in the area, I'm disappointed.
author: Alex T.

description: I now have a greater appreciation for Thai Thai Noodle.  After moving 6 blocks away, Thai Thai is no longer the closest Thai restaurant.  I've had to order from a couple other places  closer to me and they pale in comparison to my old friend Thai Thai.  So you go, my friend ... 4 stars!  I still don't like your tum yum soup, but your other dishes do a fabulous job satisfying my infrequent thai cravings.
author: Dina H.

description:
one star for good price value and prompt delivery

one star for fresh veggies, brown short grain rice and delivery of thai iced tea

one star for late night delivery, and delicious som tom salad

subtracted a star for slightly greasy sauces and a bit too spicy at times (for those of us that prefer a milder seasoning... myself not being one of them, but I respect the milder taste bud sect)
subtracted a star because noodle dishes are NOT the star of Thai Thai Noodle (ironic, I know, due to their  name)... I find their rice noodles (have tried pad thai and pad see yew) to be overly soaked/soggy and clumped, and the sauces to be under flavored. 

overall a good place for take out... consider one noodle dish, but supplement with other rice and curry dishes as well!
author: Beth P.

description: I tend to like my food really unspicy, so I go the yellow curry and it did not disappoint. I wouldn't say it's exceptional food, but the quality and price is decent. I've yet to try the dessert menu, but it looked really good.
author: Lillian S.

description: Ok so I've had issues with this place before but I went back one last time to hopefully change my mind about what I think about the place.....me thinks not is right!  How do u mess up a spring roll ? Its like they left it sitting out for an hour...very tough...took one bite and yuck...they also mest up my boyfriends order...how do u mess up bbq beef??? Instead of bbq beef they gave him some kind of beef with string beans and peppers ....I think I will stick to Thai Stick. If you are looking for real Thai food go there cause I've never had any complaints when going to Thai Stick. Avoid Thai Thai noodle eeekkkk!
author: Hayden M.

description: Pretty good food, I live around the corner from this place. Its one of my late night go to spots.  I always take it to go, they get the food prepared pretty quick and the portions are a good size.
author: Michael C.

description: Came in here for a late dinner, around 9 o'clock. Service was friendly and helpful. Only problem was the Chicken Pad See Ew was very bland in my opinion, but I tried my friend's Beef Red Curry and it wasn't half bad.
author: Anthony C.

description: I have been here about 2 times, it is really close to where i live and one time, I have to go here because it is within walking distance from the hospital, and i can't afford to go back home to cook because i have to back to the hospital  about half an hour so i am in a hurry, and the weather is cold that day, I order some curry with beef, it is ok, not special, at least it can keep me warm. It is great too because it opens late. I can get appetizer on the go. Will try some other food if i have time.
author: Thomas L.

description: Had some green curry at this small place while walking up Hyde St.  I was taking this visitor for a hike up to Lombard St and was really hungry.  Although the pad thai was spicy enough for the guest to give him a stomach upset the next day, I was OK with the spice level.  Don't expect too much of an ambience.  Reasonably priced and the location is convenient.
author: J S.

description: My friends and I were once again stuck on ideas for where to eat. By the power of my Yelp app, we were brought here. I decided to try the Tom Kha noodles. I loved the soup, so I figured it would be even better with noodles. It was for the most part, but they became so saturated that it got a little too rich for me to finish them. I would have liked to bring it back home, but decided not to. I think I would have been better off trying something else. I'll give this place another chance and pick something a little less heavy, and not so hot that my taste buds will pay the price for it the next day.
author: Rhia R.

description: This place made sub-par Pad Thai.  Seriously, that's a warning sign.  The fried tofu was soggy and the vegetables were meh.  The other main entrees our group ordered were similarly disappointing.  Although I live down the street from this place, I'll definitely be taking the longer journey to a better Thai restaurant.
author: Andrea G.

description: This place is great for what it is. We live right above and order togo all the time. If you ask for xtra meat and noodles only $2 extra which means double portion that my boyfriend and I can share. I love this place. Everything is good.
author: Samantha S.

description: Decent Thai food at a good price.  The best thing about this place is it is open till 3am.  I always just have my taxi drop me off here after the bars.  Thai Thai Spicy Beef and Pumpkin Curry are my favorite items.
author: Robb M.

description:
went today for the first time for lunch.
not crowded.
friendly waitress w/cool tat but seems a bit slow.
i had the drinken noodle. 
flavorful and generally good. not out of this world but sold. 
good price range for lunch. 
would go back and try others.
author: Diana L.

description: I ordered the duck noodle soup and pad see ew for take out. I don't recommend the duck noodle soup at all, it was too bland. The Chicken Pad See Ew for my bf was a huge portion and it was definitely better than the duck noodle soup.
author: Tien H.

description:
Boy am I glad that Thai Thai Noodle was open till 2:30am. After having a couple of drinks at Big Foot, I needed some friggin food! Thanks yelp for the "open now" filter in your android app!

First thing we noticed when we went in was a drunk girl passed out on the floor, HAHAHA!!! Somebody had a good night. Despite that, the service was prompt and the beef ball noodle soup with rice noodles was pretty good, so big I couldn't finish it, and very reasonably priced. Kind of odd that they basically had Vietnamese pho at a place called Thai Thai Noodle, but hey...it was good. 

I definitely would go back to Thai Thai Noodle next time I want some late night pho...and hope to see another drunk girl passed out on the floor, getting wheeled home in her friend's wheelchair (who had a broken foot)!
author: Matt K.

description: One of my favorite go-to restaurants. The noodle and curry dishes make my mouth water just thinking about them, my favorite is pumpkin curry which I suggest to any of my friends who are there for the first time. The service is great and friendly, the place stays open very late, and while the prices are pretty cheap, you definitely get a healthy dose of food, so hopefully you aren't shy about taking home a to-go box. The restaurant's still pretty young but I have no doubts it'll stay in business for a long while.
author: Anthony C.

description:
If Thai Thai Noodle were the only Thai restaurant in town, it would probably look pretty good.  However with several good ones in the same neighborhood within 5 minutes walking distance, I'd say it doesn't offer much except pretty low prices.

It moved in where a wonderful coffee shop was that also served Moroccan food, and I was really hoping another coffee shop would move in.  As for Thai, there are so many good choices on Polk (Chai-Yo, Modern Thai, and Thai Spice) that in my opinion have better food.

I went alone shortly after they opened and had the Pra Ram Chicken.  Was disappointed as there seemed to be very little taste, though the serviing was ample and I didn't finish it.

More recently, my girlfriend wanted to try it, and she was moderately pleased with what she had, but I thnk she enjoys Modern Thai on Polk a lot more which has great food and decor without being overpriced.

I'd go back if I'm hungry on a very rainy day, but that's about it.
author: Bob S.

description:
If I could give this place negative stars, I would.

I came in a group of 5 on a Friday morning. We ordered pad see ew, pad thai, curry, and beef noodle soup. The wait was slightly long, but the food did come eventually, and the pad see ew tasted...sour. It didn't taste good because the sourness took over the whole plate, and ugh...

Then we asked for the bill. The total was WAY more than what we ate. $78 for 5 people? Looking at it, we saw that the waiter demanded that we pay $12 tip, which I guess was 15%. But there was still no way that the total was $78. We noticed that the waiter added the total incorrectly, so we pointed that out to her. The moment I called for the waiter, she immediately pointed to the $12 and started explaining that it was the tip (very rudely, too). When I tried to explain to her that the total was wrong and not the tip, she cut me off and wouldn't let me finish. As if not rude enough, she took the bill, pretended to add up the total again, and just gave it back to us without any changes. We gave it back to her, insisting that she added it incorrectly, and then she did the math again and realized that she was indeed wrong. She then edited the bill and gave it to us. With a very dirty look, of course.

In other words, don't ever come here. Food is OKAY, service sucks....there's not much of a reason to come here.
author: Jane D.

description: I have been to Thai Thai Noodle many times. The food is just fine, but nothing extraordinary. I'm closer to the 3.5 star range, but since no halves, I'll go with 4 stars. The prices are good and it's decent enough to keep me going back time after time. They do not take any plastic for orders under $15 so make sure you have cash if you are not ordering a lot. They are open until 12am everyday so that's always nice when you need somewhere to eat late.
author: Nicole S.

description:
My best friend and I decided to have a late night snack. It was well past midnight in Russian Hill, so there weren't too many choices. We were already in our pajamas, so we refused to venture out on a random food hunt. Luckily, we found this place on Yelp and ordered for delivery. We imagined that a lot of intoxicated people would be keeping them busy at that hour. To our surprise, the food was overall pretty good and the delivery was 20 minutes quicker than they had promised.

As mentioned by our other fellow Yelpers, the portions were indeed very generous. Here's a list of what we ordered:
-Tofu pad thai 
This is our default choice at any Thai restaurant. Unfortunately, it very dry and bland. The lime it came with was also very dry. Then again, maybe it was because we had it delivered.
-Chicken kao tom 
It was described to be light and perfect for late night. Plus, we selected this because it was the first item in the chef's special section. We initially saw it as a very plain and simple dish: rice, broth, and some meat. However, we saw how it deserved to be on the chef's list; it was delicious! Rice with soup and VERY tasty ground chicken balls =  very comforting to sleep right afterwards without feeling gross.  
-Tofu Kaw Soi 
We randomly picked this because the description didn't sound like a standard Thai dish. It was a mixture of egg noodles of two kinds, crispy and thin / soft. You drench it in a flavorful light curry. It was pretty good. 

We highly recommend the latter two.

YAY! =D
author: Kathy H.

description:
THE BEST PAD THAI IN THE CITY. 
GET THE PEANUT SAUCE TO DIP THE CHICKEN IN.
HOURS ARE LATE AND GREAT.
STAFF IS ALWAYS FRIENDLY. 

My absolute favorite thai restaurant I've ever found. Enjoy it :)
author: Rachael E.

description: Ordered here for delivery the other night and had high hopes based on the other reviews. The food was delivered within a reasonable amount of time, and hot which is always good. But, it was just ok - I've had better - the food just didn't really taste that good at all. So, I won't be ordering from here again, there are way better Thai places around.
author: Kimberly R.

description: This place is good, cheap, and the portions are pretty big.  The employees are super nice, and I never have to wait longer than 15 minutes for my to go orders. The only thing is that some of the dishes I've had here are a little bland, but overall, this place gets an A.
author: cait b.

description: I've been here a few times, always in the same context. Craving thai take out and not wanting to travel far. Have had Pad Thai with different meat and Pad See Ew (with beef) was satiated each time.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Best thai food i've ever had in the states and possibly from thai land. Service is excellent, parking is easy, and place is clean. I highly recommend Thai Thai Noodle!
author: Steven E.

description: Food was good, service was sub-par. My girlfriend is allergic to wheat and dairy, and they had some trouble understanding our questions about what was in the food. But the portions were generous, and the Tom Kha soup and yellow curry we had were quite good. Thick-ish yellow curry with good strong taste, and the soup didn't have a lot of the inedibles that other places do (Ginger and roots for flavor). Definitely my favorite Thai restaurant in Nob Hill.
author: Mike M.

description: Have eaten here three times since it opened. I love the pumpkin curry with prawns - it is spicy, rich, and delicious. They get bonus points for being open so late, and the service has always been prompt and attentive.
author: Kate R.

description: I was very excited when this place finally opened since it is so close to where I live. It's perfect for takeout when I feel lazy and don't wanna cook. Although not the best Thai I have eaten, they get an extra star for being open late, nothing like a little Pad Thai when stumbling home at 2am!
author: Kelly L.

description: They just opened yesterday and the food was definitely above my expectations. I just ate the Pad See Ew and it was one of the best I have ever had. Quite pleased. Will update accordingly as the weeks go on and I try more from their menu. I am happy to have a Thai place closer to home without having to head to Polk or the TL.
author: Christina B.

description: The best thing Thai Thai Noodle has going for it is that it's open until midnight or later.  So if you're coming back from the bar/club or have some late night munchies, they're convenient.  Otherwise, the food is pretty dry.  The calamari is rubbery, the shrimp rolls are bland, the tofu is blah.
author: shojua p.

description: Tom Yum Kun was delicious and satisfying.  Something I really need to learn how to make myself.  Clean, new, affordable.  Definitely someplace I'll come back to.
author: Andy B.

description: Took me a while to get to this place as there are some Thai restaurants worth returning to around the area. But this place is very good, too. Clean restroom, clean dining area. Above average service and possibly the best yellow chicken curry East of Fillmore St. I love the 'samosas' which are aka 'curry puffs' in other realms. I am there near closing time, which is late late. Thank you Thai Thai Noodle! Also parking can be found late night within a block, fairly easily, which is more than can be said of nearby 'hotspots' in and around TH.
author: Brent J.

description: Friendly service and good prices.  Fantastic crab fried rice; great as a meal by itself.  Pick-up service is also quick, usually able to pick up my order in about 10 minutes, even if the order is fairly large (4+ items).
author: Joe A.

description:
better then thai spice and little thai. i love their beef salad and pretty much almost everything i had there so far. everything seems really fresh and flavorful. 

it's cheap and good. what more can you ask for?
author: Dot K.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and wanted to find a good Thai place that opens late and has reasonable prices. (like my favorite one in the Sunset). Came across Thai Thai noodle and ordered the chicken pad-thai for comparison. It was mediocre, not a lot of flavor. We also ordered the shrimp pineapple rice and it was excellent! The prices are a little higher than other places you can find, especially considering the ambiance of the place. Oh well, I guess that's what to expect living in Nob Hill! I would go back here but I'm still on the hunt.
author: Jamie W.

description:
I used to live just around the corner, which meant delivery was incredibly quick. Servicable, dependable, yummy. Big enough menu that you won't get bored. Sure, it might be Americanised, but if you demand cultural authenticity in your life right down to the 10pm, tired, hungry, no-food-in-the-fridge moments that take you the Thai Thai Noodle, then you are a more patient man than I. And probably angrier, too.

Edit: Kudos for being open to 2am *and* for doing delivery. A perfect combination.
author: Alex W.

description: I just moved into the neighborhood and since this place is right around the corner I decided to give them a try. I actually thought the food was decent for what it was. I tried both the Pad Ka Praw and Pad Thai and was happy with both. Some have said the Pad Thai is bland but I prefer it that way as opposed to the overly sauced versions. I'm also glad they use actual chicken rather than that tenderized crap you'd find at other places. Now I just need to try the other Thai joints in the area.
author: Jason M.

description:
2.5 stars.

They are really nice here.  A few dishes are good, but the rest of the flavors are off.  Like pink noodle soup that is sour.  I guess you have to try things and stick to the decent ones.  But they're open late if you need that option.  I think it's the Kee Mao that I really like; they use the biggest sheets of rice noodle that I've seen so far in a restaurant, which is fun.  

They gave us a dessert that was really good, although I haven't checked to see if it was on the menu.  There was an opaque white jello (Probably made of seawood jello, called agar.  I'm familiar with almond agar jello.) that was okay, but the sticky dessert rice with something like sweetened condensed milk was soooooooooo good.
author: e g.

description:
This review is for delivery 

The food was over an hour wait (on a Tuesday) - and when it got here it was cold and soggy.

I do not know if the food would have been better hot - the salmon had texture of cardboard and the samosas were soaked in grease by the time they arrived. 

The only redeeming qualities were the brown rice and the red bell peppers on the salmon.  I do not recommend ordering delivery from here. 

It seems like this place went for quantity and lost quality and service along the way.
author: MB H.

description: Me and my drunk friends stumbled in after the chairs were already stacked up and the chef had taken his apron off but never the less, the people working were warm and accommodating. As their deep fryer and some of the other kitchen equipment had already been turned off, our choices were limited but I was very happy with my chicken pad thai! very helpful, didn't rush us out even though they were CLEARLY waiting for us to leave and seemed happy to have the business - AND great food. I'll definitely return again - perhaps at a normal eating hour though!
author: Isabel T.

description: WOW!!!! Some of the BEST Thai food I have ever had! AND they're open until 3 am.  I showed up with a party of 4 and the service was great and the food was spectacular.  I STRONGLY recommend the fried shrimp rolls and angel wings for appetizer, and the fried chicken over rice.  INCREDIBLE FOOD!!!!!
author: Julian P.

description:
Ate here on opening day, and they satisfied my deep urge for Thai food.  Simple and savory. Quick kitchen. I loved their eggplant dish, and the red curry.  I highly recommend this restaurant, which was especially perfect at 2AM. 


Please ask them for homemade chili oil, because I didn't see any on the table.
author: Richard H.

description: This is my local take-out spot and it's amazzzzing. So glad it's right around the corner. Take-out usually only takes 5-10 minutes, even on a busy night.
author: Lacey R.

description:
I recommend trying the Chef's Specials. 

Those who love fish must try the Garlic Catfish. I have it over rice, and its brilliant, even if its ordered at 2:30 AM on a Saturday night.
author: Abhishek N.

description: Random walk in - needed a quick dinner. The service was very friendly and the order came quickly. I ordered take out, and got the pad thai. GROSS. The noodles were gelatinous and the tofu was cold, tasted very funny...  no flavor and was just very disappointed, I don't like being this mean but all I can think about is that I spent 9 dollars on this... ugh :( Maybe I got a bad dish??
author: Fatima E.

description: I eagerly awaited the opening of this restaurant, just 1/4 block from my office.  It was worth the wait.  Great soups, love the duck salad, yellow chicken curry, fried calamari.  Actually I have had nothing but good food here.  And the best part --- they are open late -- 2 am.  It is nice to have a new restaurant in this area.
author: Dee H.

description: There is only one thing I don't like: they put "pumpkin" in a lot of their appetizers.  I suspect that it is some sort of sweet root vegetable like sweet potato/yam and not actually pumpkin but it takes away from what would otherwise be very good veggie samusas and fried veggie spring rolls.  Other than that they are awesome.  They are open late, have reasonable prices, decent food, the place is clean, staff is very friendly and helpful, AND they deliver.  Since I work graveyard in the financial district good food after about 10pm is hard to come by down here and the fact that they deliver to me at work makes them AWESOME.  Also, just now, I called and placed an order for delivery TWO MINUTES before their scheduled closing time and they said no problem.  That's why I am writing this review right now! If they ever get rid of the "pumpkin" in those apps I'll bump it up to 5 stars.
author: Chris M.

description: mmm decent thai food and open late!!  perf for drunken munchies :D
author: Sara H.

description:
We had the calamari to start and it was OK. Different than expected but we'd order it again. The beef salad was generous and very good. The tom ka gai could have been spicier, but was tasty. The prices are fair. 

Does Anthony K even live in this neighborhood? I am thrilled to have a restaurant on the corner. I wish Thai Thai Noodle House the best of luck.
author: Tommy B.

description: Tom yum soup was okay. But my friend's dish, the shrimp eggplant was too salty.
author: Alok K.

description: 3 stars for the yummy food. Another star for the friendly wait staff and the portable heater in a stormy evening. Very considerate.
author: Bias W.

description: This is a great new place close to my house.  The space that it inhabits used to be about five different things in the last four or five years, two cafes, a fish market of some sort, a wine bar, and who knows what else.  Its good to see it not just be a neighborhood eyesore.  But the food is really good, the service is friendly and I think that they have done amazing things with the decor considering what they were given to work with.  I wish them well, and I hope that it succeeds.
author: Sara J.

description:
the link in the information is to a different restaurant (thaithaisf) which i just almost ordered from. that one is on clay street, not california

i ate take out from thai thai noodle on california: the eggplant dish, pad j. they had an option to get "over rice" and I got 15% off, so my whole meal only cost 7 dollars. the dish was very good, the tofu was well cooked and I was very happy with it
author: clancy c.
